En primer lugar, el estilo de juego ha cambiado totalmente, ya no es un RTS clasico de construir tu base y dessarollar tus tecnologÃ­as, sinÃ³ que vas con un solo edificio y sacas unidades desde allÃ­. AdemÃ¡s, ya no hay "campos de Tiberio", de hecho ni siquiera hay recursos, las unidades son gratuitas. 

En segundo lugar, hay poquÃ­simas opciones a la hora de hacer estrategias variadas, solo hay creo; unas 11 unidades. AdemÃ¡s, (aunque esto sea quizÃ¡s cosa mÃ­a) la interfaz a la hora de hacer una escaramuza, no se entiende muy bien, osÃ©ase: no sÃ© como cambiar la facciÃ³n y otras cosas varias.

column8: As a completely different RTS not in any way related to Command and Conquer yes. As a Command and Conquer game this is a hard nope, just not C&C. I now understand the frustration with this last game of the series. If you find it in a sale or a bundle sure this isn't too bad but no way in heck I would pay full price, I would only recommend  if you are looking for the final story but honestly even that was terrible and the unit cap and the login and be connected to internet at all times thing is pretty bullshit. Why not have a login once and you're good forever kinda thing instead of login to start the game and then login again once loaded through the errors to actually play the game. I would be pretty upset if I had bought this when it first came out at full price as it isn't Command and Conquer except in name only. Which is a shame as I wanted to like this game.

column9:
I absolutely can't stand EA's shitty code anymore! It crashes with even a few units; I crashed 12 times on the Kane mission. Every time I save, a pop-up appears, and if it crashes, my progress isn't counted. I just want to kill those EA bitches! Then there's the dual login issue; even offline patches can't stop EA's stupid launcher. I'm so fed up! Add to that the pop-up errors and login failures, and my blood pressure is off the charts after completing the GDI mission. The in-game stuff is even worse. Legitimate players are victims. Seriously, don't play the legitimate version; EA's experience is just awful. You can't even get a T3 unit after your first playthrough of the main story.

And then there's the unit design. What were you thinking, putting a machine gun on the chassis of the Predator 3 and creating a complete waste? And that Bulldog, what's with the candy-shooting machine?

The Titan's damage is ridiculous. The worst part is you have to find blue chests to get a unit at full health. Damn it!

I'm so angry at EA. This compilation is overflowing with error messages and pop-ups, even CC3 has them.

FXXK EA!

column9:
[h1]WANTED A MOBA, BUT GOT ASS...[/h1] 
It's hard to imagine a worse ending to the iconic franchise. There are only two sides to the conflict, three MSCs (defensive, offensive, and support) for troop production, and a handful of units on the map, thanks to a new limit. The graphics have deteriorated, as have the sound. The plot is thinly woven, the number of missions is too meager, the map and unit designs are bland, tasteless, and out of sync with the overall lore of the universe. Furthermore, the troop types don't correspond to the pilots inside, and the overall size of the vehicles doesn't match the firepower. Resources no longer need to be mined, only points of interest need to be held, just like in Company of Heroes. Green and red Tiberium crystals are collected only in designated locations and are needed to upgrade unit stats. Even Joe Kukan, played by Kane, beloved by all Nodovites, can't carry the project with his charisma.

This is a prime example of how, when marketers take on something, the result is a substance that's been overcooked five times over. Therefore, one could say the story's ending is open-ended, as this part is non-canon.
It's worth picking up only for the sake of placing this example in the player's chamber!

P.S. For the glory of Kane!

column8: Command and Conquer: Tiberian Twilight marks the conclusion of the iconic RTS series with mixed results. While it attempts to innovate with new gameplay mechanics and a persistent multiplayer experience, it deviates too far from the franchise's roots, alienating some long-time fans. The game's graphics and sound design are solid, but the restrictive unit cap and simplified base-building mechanics limit strategic depth. Despite its shortcomings, it still offers some enjoyable moments for those willing to adapt to its changes. Ultimately, Tiberian Twilight serves as a bittersweet finale to a beloved series, showcasing both its strengths and its shortcomings.

column9: For those who haven't bought it, note that buying this game is essentially useless; you can't play it anyway. Let me explain why. This game requires two logins after starting. The first login uses your EA account, and you'll need to log in multiple times to succeed. Okay, after completing the first login step, you'll enter the game. However, the game will force you to log in again. Here's the problem: you absolutely cannot log in again. Why? Because the servers are closed. Therefore, you can't log in. If you can't log in, you can't start the game. Note that this is a single-player game; you need to log in twice to start, and the second login won't even let you in! Hahaha. Happy? Surprised? So why did you spend your money?

column9: This is utter garbage from every angle! The cutscenes are formulaic and poorly acted, and they even have LGBT themes?! The gameplay is absurdly nonsensical and ridiculous! You have to choose a game type first, and you can't build many buildings, plus the tech tree is restricted by other game genres?! What the hell is this mess?! Do the developers think their innovations are cool?! The weapon designs are also bizarre, unrealistic, and a perfect demonstration of their abysmal scientific literacy! Even the login is a mess! Don't they know how many people are playing this piece of junk? They even have a platform? And a separate account and password system? The password recovery page is inaccessible? Do they feel a sense of accomplishment from scamming people out of their software?! I get furious every time I see this game! How can such garbage exist in the world?!

column9:
It was disgusting. I finished one campaign in four hours. I watched the second storyline on YouTube.

Everything about this game is absolutely bad.

The plot is bad. The jump from the third game is completely illogical, and they somehow inserted a useless love story. Kane has lost his charisma, and they clearly skimped on the cutscenes. The plot starts with nothing and ends in a completely sluggish manner.

The gameplay makes you want to close the game as soon as possible. There's no base building, no resource gathering. It's a MOBA now. After the masterpiece of the third game and its expansion, this feels like a slap in the face. The screenshots are only mentioned in the story, and the playable faction has been thrown out.

The game's graphics have also gotten worse. The style of the third game is stunning, and when you play the fourth game after it, you wonder, is this even the same game series?

Overall, there's absolutely nothing worth paying attention to in this game; the story is easier to watch in a recording in 15-20 minutes. You definitely shouldn't play it for the gameplay.

One of those two login attempts was definitely designed by Zhizhang (the game's developer).

column8:
I hate this game !
- Bad graphic. The units look like a parody of the C&C 3 Tiberium Wars.
- The new "fast" play style without base building is a punch in the face of all true fans of the franchise.
- Unlogical story ...
- The "login step" is bugged, and single-player requires an internet connection.
- The game feels cheap and was quickly produced to earn money from the franchise.

C&C 3 Tiberium Wars was better in all categories I have mentioned.

This game is a step back from the roots of C&C to casual mane stream mobile online games.

column9:
I didn't want to give a bad review, but playing it was truly a nightmare.

First, the internet connection is a hassle, and you have to download patches to make it stable (I registered an EA account a long time ago but almost never use it). Second, this installment has strayed from CNC (Comic National). Who came up with the unit restrictions? Restricting epic units like the Savior is one thing, but even regular units have a point system. Then there's the campaign tech lock. Other characters can build Mastodons or Widows, but me? Sheffield Tanks, Avenger Tanks. Using a T1 against a T3â€”what an absurd setup. I came here specifically for the campaign, and it's so awful. This campaign is the worst CNC campaign I've ever played.

I've already grinded to level 20 in GDI, and in NOD I'm just using a cheat engine to level up. Also, the NOD campaign crashes when I get to Gideon's base explosion; I don't know if it's just me or if it happens to everyone.

I won't say more; it's disgusting.

You need an EA account and to be online to even start the game.

Dozens of error messages and game restarts just to get it running because account authentication failed. Trial and attempt and attempt... until it finally works.

As for the game itself:

The controls are incredibly sluggish and don't feel very good.

All in all, the game feels very sluggish.

On the positive side, as always, there are some nice scenes with real actors.

I bought the whole c&c series for 10 dollars.
It is a total rip off.
First of all i had many issues just to run the game singleplayer.
To run most of the games i had to make LAN then edit in regedit my key because me and my friend got the same key on steam.
So just to be clear.
If you want to play with your friends you have to edit game files so that you dont have the same keys.
Also you have to edit the resolutions too.

Steam denied my refund because i requested it after 14 days.

It is possible to log into the EA server - for some reason you just need to make three of four attempts before it lets you in.

A fairly fun 'capture the flag' type game. Not as good as CNC 3, but entertaining enough.

If you are really struggling with the Steam version, then the EA application version seems to work more quickly (which may just mean a bug at Steam's end). In any case, at the time of writing (April 2024) - this game definitely works.

Fiquei surpreso com o que encontrei de forma nÃ£o muito positiva, muito diferente do que costuma se encontrar em Command & Conquer...
Sem bases onde um MCV se resume em tudo, nÃ£o podendo acelerar a construÃ§Ã£o de unidades sendo um fator importante para repor as tropas principalmente na campanha;
NÃ£o tem recursos para coletar, pode treinar a vontade desde que tenha cÃ©lulas populacionais, e uns cristais de tiberium espalhados pelo mapa, sÃ³ se pega isso algumas vezes para melhorar as unidades...
Tropas muito limitadas no fator quantidade, ai eu me pergunto como passo uma fase em que tenho no mÃ¡ximo 15 unidades contra 4x mais do inimigo, Ã© uma missÃ£o inicial ainda entÃ£o resumindo nÃ£o tem muita coisa para treinar ou melhorar... Infelizmente desbalanceado;
NÃ£o gostaria de dizer isso sobre o game mas para mim Ã© um jogo bem fora de C&C e ruim tambÃ©m, Ã© jogÃ¡vel mas tem momentos que irritam o jogador...
Se vocÃª quer um C&C bom que tenha bons grÃ¡ficos com certeza Ã© o C&C 3 de longe o melhor nesse caso, ou atÃ© mesmo vale a pena tentar os clÃ¡ssicos tambÃ©m muito bons mesmo, atÃ© o C&C 2 que ficou dividido entre amor e Ã³dio...
Meu amigo C&C 4 foi o pior que jÃ¡ joguei, no caso se enjoar de todos o C&C aÃ­ sim jogue esse pois encontrarÃ¡ um experiencia diferente que para mim foi estranha e desagradÃ¡vel, mas pelo menos Ã© algo diferente para tentar aliviar a mente das batalhas frenÃ©ticas dos outros jogos da franquia!
column9:
I was surprised by what I found, which wasn't very positive, very different from what you usually find in Command & Conquer...

Without bases where a MCV (Multiple Lifecycle) system is everything, you can't accelerate the construction of units, which is an important factor in replenishing troops, especially in the campaign;
There are no resources to collect, you can train as much as you want as long as you have population cells, and some tiberium crystals scattered around the map, you only get these a few times to improve the units...
Troops are very limited in terms of quantity, so I wonder how I get through a level where I have a maximum of 15 units against 4 times more of the enemy, it's still an initial mission so in short there's not much to train or improve... Unfortunately unbalanced;

I wouldn't like to say this about the game, but for me it's a game that's very different from C&C and bad too. It's playable, but there are moments that irritate the player...
If you want a good C&C game with good graphics, C&C 3 is definitely the best in that case, or it's even worth trying the classics, which are also very good, even C&C 2, which was divided between love and hate...
My friend, C&C 4 was the worst I've ever played. If you get tired of all the C&C games, then play this one because you'll find a different experience that, for me, was strange and unpleasant, but at least it's something different to try to relieve your mind from the frantic battles of the other games in the franchise!

column9: I had to create an EA account, so I couldn't play right away. Then there was the connection problem, so I couldn't play then either. Then I got disconnected and lost my progress (I had to redo mission 1 twice). I redid mission 1, got to mission 2, and spent five minutes trying to figure out how to deploy a defense turret. And frankly, I'm not going to waste any more time. If a simple building action from previous games isn't possible here, I'm giving up. That's it, they've discouraged me, I've quit the game. A message to the developers: your salary on this saga is illegal, may God put you out of work.

column8:
I had forgotten how truly awful this steaming pile of EA fail is.   I am an original C&C player from the very beginning and this was the worst entry by far.  Even Generals which is a game made entirely of place holder graphics is a better offering than this.   I ended up with it because I wanted the digital versions of the series and though I'd see if I was remembering how bad it is correctly and it is very, VERY bad.

When it was first pulled from the overflowing EA executive toilets and placed on the market, I decided to get a more.... Swedish preview to see if the hate was justified...... I still wanted a refund for the bandwidth and time wasted, not to mention the brain bruises from trying to make it through two missions.

DO NOT BUY THIS!!!

Tiberian Twilight
Due to the influx of players, the C&C4 servers are having some problems with initial login. If you receive a General system error message, the only option is to keep trying.

You can skip the initial launcher by putting the following in your Steam launch options: cmd /c ""PATH-TO-GAMEFOLDER\Data\CNC4.game" -config "..\CNC4_English.SkuDef" %COMMAND% and change the path to match the actual path to your game, and change the English SkuDef to whatever language you're using. This option will NOT work if you do not already have an EA account--the game will boot but you will be greeted with the second login screen without a create account option.

The following files can be renamed or deleted to skip the startup logo:

CNC4Logo.vp6
ea.vp6
EALogo.snd
EALogo.vp6

Tiberian Twilight es un tÃ­tulo con luces y muchas sombras. Como secuela y epÃ­logo de la saga Tiberian puede resultar decepcionante, pero como juego en sÃ­ mismo es medianamente pasable y entretenido. A tÃ­tulo personal, estÃ¡ lejos de ser el desastre que la crÃ­tica general apuntÃ³ allÃ¡ en el 2010, aÃ±o en el que se estrenÃ³. 

El principal problema -si exceptuamos las comparaciones con otros juegos de la misma saga- radica en que 
replantea todo su sistema jugable que tradicionalmente consistiÃ³ en gestiÃ³n de bases de combate y unidades a favor de un sistema orientado al multijugador -no hay control de bases, solo un nÃºmero limitado de unidades y un sistema de puntos-, asÃ­ como defensa y conquista de torres. La jugabilidad que plantea es cÃ³moda, mÃ¡s o menos se aprende rÃ¡pido pero carece de profundidad porque apenas deja al jugador opciones para enfrentarse a los desafÃ­os. El tono es lineal y de escasa maniobra. Es decir, es un tÃ­tulo de estrategia RTS pero sin estrategia, solo dejando la parte de acciÃ³n.

A dÃ­a de hoy los pocos alicientes que un jugador puede encontrar para jugarlo es... la campaÃ±a, el modo historia porque el multijugador estÃ¡ poco mÃ¡s que muerto. Si eres fan de la saga Command and Conquer vale la pena jugarlo -aunque genere sentimientos encontrados-. Su modo historia tiene un planteamiento interesante -dramÃ¡tico, seria y con cierto carÃ¡cter Ã©pico-; el gran inconveniente es su escasa duraciÃ³n y la falta de un mayor desarrollo. 

Un Ãºltimo apunte, solo necesitas introducir tu cuenta de EA/Origin para iniciar el juego -puede surgir algÃºn error de inicio pero se solventa fÃ¡cilmente volviendo a introducir los datos o esperando un rato-. 

Recomendado para el fan de la saga Command and Conquer. Por lo demÃ¡s, un tÃ­tulo pasable y jugabilidad anecdÃ³tica.
column9:
Tiberian Twilight is a title with both strengths and weaknesses. As a sequel and epilogue to the Tiberian saga, it may be disappointing, but as a standalone game, it's moderately passable and entertaining. Personally, I think it's far from the disaster that critics generally labeled it back in 2010, the year of its release.

The main problemâ€”if we disregard comparisons with other games in the same seriesâ€”lies in the fact that it completely redesigns its gameplay system, which traditionally consisted of managing combat bases and units, in favor of a multiplayer-oriented systemâ€”there's no base control, only a limited number of units and a point systemâ€”as well as tower defense and conquest. The gameplay it offers is comfortable and relatively quick to learn, but it lacks depth because it barely gives the player options for facing challenges. The tone is linear and offers little room for maneuvering. In other words, it's an RTS strategy title without strategy, focusing solely on the action.

Currently, the few incentives a player can find to play it are... the campaign and the story mode, because the multiplayer is practically dead. If you're a fan of the Command and Conquer saga, it's worth playingâ€”even if it evokes mixed feelings. Its story mode has an interesting premiseâ€”dramatic, serious, and with a certain epic feel; the major drawback is its short length and lack of further development.

One last point: you only need to enter your EA/Origin account to start the gameâ€”you might encounter a startup error, but it's easily resolved by re-entering the information or waiting a while.

Recommended for fans of the Command and Conquer saga. Otherwise, it's a passable title with unremarkable gameplay.

Obviously it's a failure of a sequel to a well-established series, but if you're like me, you probably wonder, "How does it stand up on its own merits?" And honestly, story aside, it's not a /terrible/ game... In fact, I'd even say it's quite good!

For mobile.

This is basically a mobile game on PC. If it WERE on mobile, I actually think it might've been decently liked, with more of its flaws overlooked in favor of accessibility.

Most other reviews are tinged with disappointment at what this game represents in the series, but very little as to what the game actually is. There are definitely much worse games out there, and I still squeezed some hours out of this one, it's just not a very memorable game either. I'm only giving it a positive because it's cheap, but it's tenuous considering you have to jump some hoops to even make this emblem of mediocrity playable.

Die Modelle, deren Texturen und Animationen stammen aus der HÃ¶lle (warum hat man nicht einfach die bereits vorhandenen genutzt?!). Das Gameplay ist vÃ¶llig verÃ¤ndert und nicht einmal mehr im Ansatz mit dem der vorherigen Teile zu vergleichen. Man fÃ¼hlt sich an einfache Handyspiele erinnert. 

Desweiteren wird die wirre Story, die man in Tiberian Sun begonnen hat, konsequent schlecht und unnÃ¶tig umfangreich (also von der VideolÃ¤nge her, nicht inhaltlich) weitergesponnen.

column9:
Command & Conquer 4 doesn't live up to its bad reputationâ€”it's even worse! It feels like playing a half-baked mod for Warcraft 3. The models, their textures, and animations are atrocious (why didn't they just use the existing ones?!). The gameplay is completely different and bears no resemblance whatsoever to previous installments. It's reminiscent of simple mobile games.

Furthermore, the convoluted story begun in Tiberian Sun continues in a consistently poor and unnecessarily lengthy manner (in terms of video length, not content).

EA should urgently introduce an idiot test for managers. I simply cannot fathom how such a miserable amateurish effort passed quality control.

column8:
I played this when it came out as I was a huge C&C fan and would play all the titles. remembered some small details from it when I played it back then in 2010, but couldn't remember how it felt playing. I installed it again as I wanted to finish the C&C storyline regardless of all the negative reviews, the story was only interesting to me to finish and never play it again.

To summarize - I played 2 missions and the game is so awful and such a horrible deviation from all the C&C titles and I was severely demotivated to further go through it and I was okay with not finishing the story which was never the case.

I simply couldn't go through it further as the gameplay is so repulsive comparing to the 90% rest of the C&C titles (I am looking at you Red Alert 3).

I thought I had a valid excuse to go through this game, but there is not a single one to go through and learn the gameplay if you played the previous titles. It deserves that it ends up forgotten and and never mentioned again.

Loved the C&C franchise and the RTS games and I am sad to see that it was concluded like this with current sole focus on the embarrasing mobile games that pulls the people in for microtransactions solely on the nostalgia and its former glory.

Peace through power !

column8:
General System Error.

Even if it wasn't a fucked mess that relied on always online DRM to even function (thanks EA)

https://www.stopkillinggames.com/

it feels like some exec heard that MOBAs were the hot new thing, and tried to pare down everything until it was an easily digestible slurry for the league of legends crowd. If you wanted the small scale fleet, with a powerful unit you use as a base, go pick up deserts of karak, because some idiot also decided to lock the entire tech tree behind grinding

to elaborate, imagine having the ability to deal with certain units completely walled off to you until you sit down and grind 20 hours of their godawful capture the flag minigame to progress

it feels like they took a perfectly serviceable RTS, dissected it, and reassembled it wrong
forget smashing through defenses to deliver the killing blow to your opponent, that dumbass can just respawn
forget making a hilarious unstoppable death ball, you got 30 population cap, and the smallest unit takes 3 pop
and even then, everything but the most basic units are all locked behind tedious grinding.
go fuck yourself EA

column8:
Der Grabstein einer ansonsten groÃŸartigen Serie. Das bisherige Spielsystem wird vollkommen auf den Kopf gestellt und von einem RTS mit Basenbau in eine MOBA Variante verwandelt. Hierzu kann ich das Video von Gamestar zum Niedergang von Command and Conquer empfehlen.

Das Spiel ist so sinnvoll wie ein Kropf.
Zudem muss man sich mehrfach anmelden, was teilweise auch noch fehlerhaft ist. FÃ¼r ein 14 Jahre altes Spiel echt nervig.
Spielt lieber Teil 2 oder 3
column9:
The tombstone of an otherwise great series. The established gameplay is completely turned on its head, transforming it from an RTS with base building into a MOBA variant. I recommend GameStar's video on the decline of Command & Conquer.

The game is about as useful as a chocolate teapot.

Furthermore, you have to log in multiple times, which is sometimes buggy. For a 14-year-old game, that's really annoying.

Better to play part 2 or 3.

column8:
Okay, so i'm joining the overwhelmingly negative review squad here, and there are three main reasons for this.

1) the login headache - yep everyone and their mothers is yapping on about this and to be honest i'm joining them, it took me about 30 mins or so to brute force this sodding thing to finally let me cause of the fact they shut the servers down for the ea login in thing. like i said i did eventually get the thing to work but honest i dont need that kind of headache when all i want to do is play a sodding game.

2) played a few missions and then i got to this gdi one called cold hard truth, good god that one is annoying as hel cause the secondary objective requires you to stop this excavation teams from pulling up some old tanks from a previous war. okay i thought do that and nab them for myself no problems, only there is the sodding problem right away cause it goes one of two ways - either the ai bottles you up in a corner until they can nick these things or if you do actually bum rush them and get the tanks guess what, the ai spams these commando drone things that run up, disable and then out right nick them from you. oh and did we mention that these little buggers have an insane health/armour pool on them .... yeah have fun numbnuts cause if you do actually manage to kill the thing they just nicked, no biggy for them cause they will just run over and nick another tank in like 5 seconds. so your playing 5 mins of "WILL YOU BLOODY KILL THAT IDIOT ALREADY".

3) final point - tiberium is now pretty much useless what the heck, what i mean by this is in the previous game tiberium was everything. if you didn't have it your weren't building/upgrade/training anything so it was pretty much a necessity and i loved that cause it made me be strategic about what the heck i was doing and helped me control my enemies cause they too were bond to the need for tiberium but in this game is just a temporary power shiny thing and thats it. you want units oh no probs just use command points instead oh and your enemies have that too so good luck with the constant army spamming.

Yeah at this point i just went "fluff if, i'm uninstalling and never playing this abortion ever again".

Okay, so i'm joining the overwhelmingly negative review squad here, and there are three main reasons for this.

1) the login headache - yep everyone and their mothers is yapping on about this and to be honest i'm joining them, it took me about 30 mins or so to brute force this sodding thing to finally let me cause of the fact they shut the servers down for the ea login in thing. like i said i did eventually get the thing to work but honest i dont need that kind of headache when all i want to do is play a sodding game.

2) played a few missions and then i got to this gdi one called cold hard truth, good god that one is annoying as hel cause the secondary objective requires you to stop this excavation teams from pulling up some old tanks from a previous war. okay i thought do that and nab them for myself no problems, only there is the sodding problem right away cause it goes one of two ways - either the ai bottles you up in a corner until they can nick these things or if you do actually bum rush them and get the tanks guess what, the ai spams these commando drone things that run up, disable and then out right nick them from you. oh and did we mention that these little buggers have an insane health/armour pool on them .... yeah have fun numbnuts cause if you do actually manage to kill the thing they just nicked, no biggy for them cause they will just run over and nick another tank in like 5 seconds. so your playing 5 mins of "WILL YOU BLOODY KILL THAT IDIOT ALREADY".

3) final point - tiberium is now pretty much useless what the heck, what i mean by this is in the previous game tiberium was everything. if you didn't have it your weren't building/upgrade/training anything so it was pretty much a necessity and i loved that cause it made me be strategic about what the heck i was doing and helped me control my enemies cause they too were bond to the need for tiberium but in this game is just a temporary power shiny thing and thats it. you want units oh no probs just use command points instead oh and your enemies have that too so good luck with the constant army spamming.

Yeah at this point i just went "fluff if, i'm uninstalling and never playing this abortion ever again".

column9:
By far the worst installment in the series and a piece of junk that doesn't deserve the title "Command & Conquer." I only bought it because it was included in the "Command & Conquerâ„¢ The Ultimate Collection on Steam" bundle, and you couldn't deselect it individually... you're forced to buy it.

What's especially infuriating is that the game doesn't even work because you have to connect to their server to play, and that's simply impossible because they probably shut it down ages ago.

Pro tip: You can return the game at https://help.steampowered.com/de/. And you can only return this one game from the bundle (it suddenly becomes possible to select individual games there). At least you can get your â‚¬1.99 back, which the game wouldn't have been worth even if it had worked.

column8:
So, first of all, you can't login. Maybe you could if you have an existing EA account, but I created a new account and I can't freaking login. Did all that password, link steam account, still can't login. So you have to keep trying after "general system error" messages. Same as inside the game. Well, I don't understand why do I have to login again inside the game which require authentication to start. 

After dealing with login issue(s). Just played first mission. The opening movie made me feel like I was watching ptube. That creepy ass wife/girlfriend chills me out. Where did they find these ppl FFS. There is a difference between real crews and movie casts. Unlike movies in Red Alert 2 which were fun to watch. These are just bunch of embarrassment. 

Those vehicles look like made of paper. Sliding/jittering on the ground. Promping you to use q or box to select all units then what? With all that babysitting of highlight and message boxes, you have to tell me what to do. You want me to move the selected units to some place or do something? Hello? 

During the mission, you have to do exactly what they want you to do. You just can't scout ahead. At certain unmarked check points, you must have your unit stand beside the tranport you need to protect. I mean this game was released in 2010 yeah? were level designer interns too? Considering it's EA, it could be true.

FXXK YOU EA!!! YOU FXXKING AXXHOLE FXXK CNC UP!!!
column9:
I don't understand what kind of mentality EA had when, after releasing an epic masterpiece like Command & Conquer 3, they produced such a terrible pile of crap as Command & Conquer 4. Aside from the background story and world-building, they completely ripped out everything from the previous game, including the game mechanics, and released a "masterpiece" that I'm shocked to find: a campaign that can only be completed using one-third of the unit types and two-thirds of the tech tree, a population cap of 60 but a single tank taking up 6 units, and no multi-production sequences where all units are produced from the base. And you actually have the nerve to claim that "you can command more units than any other Command & Conquer game!" Even Company of Heroes has more controllable units than Command & Conquer 4; Kane, a cult pope, has less real power than a company commander. And that's just the crap in the game itself; there's even bigger crap outside the game: EA, are you an idiot? You made a single-player game with a completely online connection, requiring two logins, and then there's a bug where you have to go to the official website to change your password before you can log in again. Seriously, what a load of crap!

FXXK YOU EA!!! YOU FXXKING AXXHOLE FXXK CNC UP!!!

column9: A total disaster. You need an online connection to play, it's an RTS where you have to collect points to win in PvP. And if you think you've unlocked all the units in PvP, no way! You have to gain experience in the game to unlock units and weapons. Completely tedious.

column8:
Being an avid fan all RTS games, but the C&C games in particular, I was really excited to try this out. Boy was i wrong...
if it wasnt part of a bundle id curse steam for not giving refunds. the name C&C and the genre of RTS are the only things that even resemble the original games or even the genre in general. it plays nothing like any of the previous titles or pretty much any RTS ive ever tried for that matter and not in a good way.

i can understand making adjustments or adding/removing features or whatever devs gotta do to stay relevant and keep things fresh. but they took a well known and very much liked idea, strapped it to a rocket intended to propel a ship to another galaxy and drove it straight into the ground from orbit. if i didnt know any better id say this was either released as an actual attempt to bankrupt the company for some reason or whoever was in charge was recently replaced by a chimpanzee. 

this game is the equivalent of combining fallout and fallguys and calling it the next call of duty. with this title the C&C you want, you aint gettin and the C&C you gettin, you dont want.

column8:
I tried my best, but unfortunately every method of accessing the game led to failure. Kept hitting a wall at every turn.
I like testing bad games to see what good can be brought to the surface, to be positive on something and find enjoyment in the badly executed, but this game literally blocks me at its entrance. 
It is a shame that I will not be able to try this game again since years ago I found some fun moments in its campaign and, no doubt, with this new more positive view on bad games I would have come out of the experience with a decently positive review. (and I say this as a fan of the Command&Conquer series)

I, with all honesty and care, can not recommend a game that does not even allow players to go past the login screen ( the first of two login screens to be precise ).  It is a dice roll at each step and the house has full advantage with their rigged dice.

column8:
So funny enough. This game is not compatible with the EA launcher.
If the EA launcher is open when I try to log into this game it gives "General system error"
Close it out completely (like from the taskbar too), log in twice to an ancient game no one seemed to like, and I find myself escorting Kane on the opening transport mission.
But in a world with games that require multiple launchers in order to run this is what your going to get.
I'm sure this won't fix everyone's problems. And I can't recommend this game just on the basis that it is crippled by software made by it's own publishers. Software that one could expect to be open upon launching this game.

column8:
C&C: Tiberian Twilight:

It is time we ascend my brother!

What is up with the spelling mistakes? Tiberium/Tiberian? WTF to that!

It received a lot of bad reviews on release, but I quite enjoyed it! The only thing worse than ''Origin'' are the insanely stupid login into the server. Sigh! Come now EA.

At a glance: ?/100
______________________________________________________________________
Graphics:__________Still nice
Gameplay__________Strategy is fun
Audio_____________Good
PC Requirements______Your rig will do. The game is old
Difficulty___________We play on HARD. Always!
Grind_____________None. Just fun
Story_____________Those live-action movies are the best. They never get boring
Game Time________Well I invested a lot of time back in the day....Does that count?
Price_____________SALE!
Bugs_____________EA, What is up with your login procedures? It's dumb, take it away!
Verdict____________I Recommend this one

Sincerely
Bromst0ne

[h1]I've never seen a game with a character limit for the password field. My password was too long to type in completely, which prevented me from logging in. Seriously? EA, if you can't stand your father's big dam, just say so. Limiting the number of characters is like your mother's dead. You think you can decide how long a user's password is? I'm so pissed off! Did your mother have to cut her body into two pieces and bury half while the other half rotted away? A brainless game with a brainless companyâ€”what a waste of CNC's title! A promising start but a disappointing ending? A snake's tail, a limp swan! [/h1]

(P.S. Thanks to the netizens for pointing out the errors, thank you!)

column8:
Played through the first few missions and this game made me feel depressed. It seems unfinished and extremely unpolished. The basic idea of this game itself isn't all bad. Mobile bases are an interesting idea imo, the execution, however, is horrendous. That's not all. The story and presentation of the scenario is god awful like a cheap, nonsensical B-movie. 
My diagnosis: EA attempted to jump on the MOBA hypetrain, failed miserably and ruined a franchise along the way.  Why? Corporate greed? Misguided understanding of what strategy gamers really want? It seems to be a combination of different reasons - a proper clusterfuck.

Played through the first few missions and this game made me feel depressed. It seems unfinished and extremely unpolished. The basic idea of this game itself isn't all bad. Mobile bases are an interesting idea imo, the execution, however, is horrendous. That's not all. The story and presentation of the scenario is god awful like a cheap, nonsensical B-movie. 
My diagnosis: EA attempted to jump on the MOBA hypetrain, failed miserably and ruined a franchise along the way.  Why? Corporate greed? Misguided understanding of what strategy gamers really want? It seems to be a combination of different reasons - a proper clusterfuck.

column9:
[Original] Method for running without internet connection + Chinese localization: 1. Right-click on the game in your Steam library, select Properties, change the language to "Traditional Chinese," and wait for the download to complete (if the download fails, try a US server).

2. Download Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight from 3DM. Traditional Chinese Offline Crack Patch

3. Run the patch as administrator (right-click) and install it to the game's main directory.

4. Right-click the game in your Steam library, select Properties, verify the integrity of the game, and wait for the download to complete.

5. Open the game's main directory and run CNC4SERVER.exe (do not close this program while playing).

6. Log in to the game using the account located in your main directory/Accounts/email/account.xml (external launchers still require you to log in with your legitimate EA account).

7. In the game, check the following settings: Options/General/Show Subtitles

(Detailed tutorial link: zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/689964118)

ã€Notesã€‘
1. External launchers still require you to log in with your EA account.

2. The offline patch will modify the system hosts file. To restore network connectivity, please clear the hosts file.

3. Unlocking units in this game requires experience. You can modify the experience value in account.xml; increasing it will unlock all units. However, the value cannot be too large, otherwise you will not be able to enter the game (you can reduce it to a smaller value).

4. Please use the save/load function, because the offline patch will prevent your level progress from being saved to EA's servers. You can only continue playing from where you left off by loading a save file.

[Trainer] Please download the MrAntiFun version of the trainer; other versions are incompatible.

Man braucht ein EA-Konto zum spielen. 
*!-Wichtig-!* fÃ¼r den Ingame-Login, hier herrschen Unterschiede zu den heutigen Passwortrichtlinien  von EA!

Man braucht ein EA-Konto zum spielen, was eigentlich nicht erklÃ¤rt werden muss. Benutzt dazu ein Passwort mit mindestens 8 Zeichen (aber nicht lÃ¤nger als 24 Zeichen), GroÃŸ- u. Kleinbuchstaben, eine Zahl und ein Sonderzeichen. Ich musste mein komplexeres lÃ¤ngeres Passwort anpassen, da ich damit auch nicht ins Spiel kam. Viele schreiben hier, dass man nicht mehr auf den EA-Server kommen wÃ¼rde, aber wenn man das mit den Passwort beachtet, sollte es reibungslos mit dem einloggen klappen.

Mir persÃ¶nlich macht der vierte Teil von C&C keinen groÃŸen SpaÃŸ. Hier wollte man wohl damals das Spiel fÃ¼r E-Sports Events anpassen, was nicht sonderlich gut funktionierte. Kein echter Basenbau mehr, sondern mobile fliegende BauhÃ¶fe, hektischeres Gameplay und strategische Kartenpunkte die man zeitlich mit Einheiten besetzen muss. Das seltsame Skillsystem passt auch nicht wirklich in die Reihe. Ein absoluter Bruch mit der ursprÃ¼nglichen C&C - Formel.

Wenn man das C&C-Bundle erworben hat, ist es halt dabei. Von einem Einzelkauf dieses Titels wÃ¼rde ich persÃ¶nlich auf jeden Fall abraten, auch wenn Kane eine coole durchgeknallte Socke ist.
column9:
You need an EA account to play.

*Important!* for in-game login: there are differences compared to EA's current password guidelines!

You need an EA account to play, which shouldn't need explaining. Use a password with at least 8 characters (but no longer than 24 characters), uppercase and lowercase letters, a number, and a special character. I had to change my more complex, longer password because I couldn't get into the game with it. Many people are saying they can no longer access the EA servers, but if you follow the password guidelines, logging in should work smoothly.

Personally, I'm not enjoying the fourth installment of C&C very much. It seems they wanted to adapt the game for e-sports events, which didn't work very well. There's no more real base building; instead, there are mobile flying construction yards, more hectic gameplay, and strategic map points that you have to occupy with units within a time limit. The strange skill system doesn't really fit the series either. A complete departure from the original C&C formula.

If you've purchased the C&C bundle, it's included. I would definitely advise against buying this title separately, even though Kane is a cool, crazy guy.

The game is a good C&C game with tweaked mechanics. 

Regarding the login problem, it is due to the password length and characters used.

Remember that the game is old, so change your account password to contain utf-8 chars and its length to a maximum of 16 characters. I did that and I was able to pass the 2nd login and play it.

column8: I know it's an unpopular opinion, but I like this game a lot. Sure, it was boring at the beginning, but you have to go past that and give it more time to kind of settle. Over some time I realized it's fun just cause it's different. The concept is kind of a nice refreshment from the typical boring RTS concept. There is a lot of strategy involved in the capturing and holding nodes. Sure it's simplified. But sometimes you need that in an rts game. And it's not that simple if you just give it a chance and get into it. Also I love the visual effects (explosions, battle flares, tracer bullets etc. ) it just adds to the overall realistic experience.

PLEASE READ!!

Everyone who is complaining about not being able to log in, this game was very recently re-released on steam. Steam compensates for the lack of servers for most games. I had to log in 4 times in launcher before i could start the game, but i assure you, it works. Anyone who says otherwise is either only trying once, or has some kind of bug. I had no issue with it. I mean yeah its annoying to log in 4 times just to start the game, but it DOES work. I know the gameplay is nowhere near as exciting or interesting as the other C&C's, however I still love it.

column9: So, we all know by now that you guys have ruined C&C. It's been out since 2010, I never played it until now, and now I know why. What you've done here isn't C&C, it's some cheap pile of crap... How can you set a limit (50) for units that's quickly reached when some cost 1 unit and others around 5, meaning you only have a handful? And then there's this awful single-player mode where you're the only one allowed to fight against two crawlers (construction yards). Even on Easy difficulty, it's not easy. One thing I know for sure: nobody was sober when this game was developed. The best part is that you need an EA account, then have to log in twice at the beginning, and then you get a server disconnect in the middle of the game, so you have to start the whole thing all over again. EA, stop developing games, you're incompetent... let the professionals do it.

column8:
Thought I'd see what all the fuss was about. 

Tried to log into EA, wouldn't let me..had to create a new password. 

Created a new password. 

Tried to log into EA, wouldn't let me. General system error. 

Tried to log into EA, wouldn't let me. General system error. 

Tried to log into EA, wouldn't let me. General system error. 

Logged into EA. 

Watched an into scene that was made using 1994 level graphics. 

Entered a username. 

Screen went black. 

Game playing in background but wouldn't open. 

Used task manager, didn't work. 

Tried to navigate to other programmes, PC stuck on desktop. 

Wrote this review, then went for a cup of tea with a renewed and more profound hatred for EA gnawing at my shrivelled soul.

IT'S IN THE GAME!

The game is alright. It's really spongy though, like nothing dies. One mission you can literally just unpack your base and just run to the goal and win, lol. 

It has a lot of good concepts, but the balancing isn't there. This game is also hard to stream on, as when I have ULTRA everything, the game crashes, so I ran it on low.

Overall, it's a really unique game with good concepts, but again, the balancing wasn't there at all. Units deal no damage, some units are insanely tanky, some units are insanely squishy. The story is also confusing and ends on a crap note.

column9:
I've been the biggest C&C fan since the series began, but this installment is the absolute worst... The final nail in the coffin of the Command & Conquer series... Any cheap knock-off would be better than this game.

The first reason is the online requirement. You have to have an EA account and log in to start the game, but no, after starting, you have to log in again and enter your password before you even get to the main menu. What kind of mentally deranged idiot came up with this crap?! They should be banned from the industry immediately.

As if that weren't bad enough, the game crashes immediately if the internet connection drops for even a second, and then you have to log in again... This is the absolute worst...

As for the game itself, base building has been removed, and there's a radical unit limit. The core and heart of the series has simply been ripped out. This game is a disgrace. It's a disgrace that it's even allowed to be called Command & Conquer. It doesn't deserve this name.

Why didn't they make C&C Generals 2 instead? Generals is one of my favorite installments, along with Alert 2 and 3.

If this terrible game had been nipped in the bud, the Command & Conquer series might still exist today, but this disgrace buried the franchise.

The story is incredibly flat and boring, and the entire gameplay is no fun since you can't build buildings or command many units.
























... I strongly advise against buying this piece of historical disgrace....

I sincerely hope that after the remastering of the first two installments, further installments will be released, especially Tiberium Sun - Renegade and Red Alert 2, and most importantly, Generals with Zero Hour.......

To the developers of this game: Shame on you for even releasing something like this and charging money for it... Even as a gift, this installment is a punishment... Clean up your act and finally make good installments and remakes of the old series again, then hopefully the franchise will get a new lease on life. My heart truly bleeds over this game :-( I still mourn the money I spent on it back then.....

To be honest, the game has a really solid gameplay and its own charm. That's if it was not a Command and Conquer game. No base building, no gathering resource, no anything that makes the series great. Not to mention the horrible campaign, the worst, ever.
With that being said, I quite enjoy the game, not the campaign of course. The game would be more successful if they got rid of the campaign and released it as a spin off, an alternative universe, a mobile game or simply unrelated to C&C at all.
Yes, I know it deserves a thumb down but I've seen enough. Therefore, one blue hand.

column8: It's definitely not the best game out there, what with the meaningless plot and contrived characters (though Kane, Gideon and Col. James were decent enough in their portrayals, given what they had), the pointless emotional arc involving the wife, the always-online gameplay, the tedious leveling system, and the small pop cap limit. Still, it's decent enough if you play it with friends; some of the unit designs are pretty nifty, too. Still a bloody shame with how this was supposed to be the finale to the C&C series. 3/60 command points.

column8:
i find it very odd that this was my first entry into the C&C series and before i knew what the internet was i held this game on a high regard of everything i first played this around 2011 or 2012 coming back to it in 2024 soured my opinion of this game because i was exposed to better games in the series during the years and i wanna like it to be honest but i can't its a flawed game with always online internet collection and tedious grinding for units and no resources instead replaced by a pop cap to around 50-70 and idk how i used to like this story because its so flawed with one dimensional characters and it takes itself too seriously  the few things i did like were some of the units design like mastadon hunter and raider and the soundtrack while generic it works i wouldn't recommend this but since most people buying C&C while probably buy this because of the collection i would say its worth a first playthrough and if u like the micro intense gameplay go for it 
24/50 command points
column9:
i find it very odd that this was my first entry into the C&C series and before i knew what the internet was i held this game on a high regard of everything i first played this around 2011 or 2012 coming back to it in 2024 soured my opinion of this game because i was exposed to better games in the series during the years and i wanna like it to be honest but i can't its a flawed game with always online internet collection and tedious grinding for units and no resources instead replaced by a pop cap to around 50-70 and idk how i used to like this story because its so flawed with one dimensional characters and it takes itself too seriously  the few things i did like were some of the units design like mastadon hunter and raider and the soundtrack while generic it works i wouldn't recommend this but since most people buying C&C while probably buy this because of the collection i would say its worth a first playthrough and if u like the micro intense gameplay go for it 
24/50 command points

column8:
this game just f-cking sucks lmao
retcons c&c3 stuff
looks worse than c&c generals
generally doesn't feel good to play
traditional rts systems (resourcing, base building, diverse army compositions) gone in favor of MCVs being able to deploy only one type (air, vehicle, infantry) of unit depending on crawler style
skirmishes are control point based and tiberium nodes are used for upgrades, army is limited by population cap, just doesn't feel like a c&c game really.

edit: forgot to mention every time I boot the game I have to brute force the login screen over six times, only to be greeted by a second log in screen when I'm in the client. Alt tabbing caused the game to crash once which forced me to redo this process.

column8: This is not C&C. it's a arena type game. You might like to play this but dont think it's C&C with updated graphics and a C&C game that utilizes game technology of that time, it is not like any of that. You have a max unit count that dont cost resources, no base building as you need to bring your main everywhere with you, no recourse managment/gathering. The mission where you need to protect fleeing civilions is the mission I stopped playing. It felt like I needed a coop partner for it or play the map in only 1 way to beat it or just be stuck in an endless loop as it doesn't matter how many civilions are killed, there is an endless horde of them. Atleast make it a achievment when the 100th car has blown up "LOL did you see that guy flying" or something like that because it doesn't take the whole mission serious. So immersion, yeah you guessed it, 0.... It feels like a multiplayer focused game that was forced to have a singleplayer campaign and coop exists to make it easier and make your friends buy the game to so they can make more money.

column8:
Are there people who probably enjoyed this game? Yes. It concludes the story of Tiberium, GDI, Nod, and Kane. So if you feel like you have to play it for that, find a youtube cinematic splice. You'll spend less time and frustration fighting this game that way.
This game cannot be run in windowed mode, cannot be played in offline mode, and what fun it offers can be found in greater abundance elsewhere.
See here (https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198261318059/recommended/47700/) if you have picked this up as part of EA's "so we finally gave up on origin" steam release, if you want to unlink the game from your library.

column8:
If youâ€™re looking for a game that redefines the term â€œbase-buildingâ€ to mean â€œclicking furiously on a screen full of chaos,â€ then C&C4 might just be your jam. Itâ€™s the game that took the beloved RTS formula, threw it out the window, and replaced it withâ€¦ something else.

Graphics: Shiny enough to distract you from the gameplay. 
Story: Kaneâ€™s last stand? More like his last stumble. 
Gameplay: Remember when strategy was a thing? Pepperidge Farm remembers. 
Multiplayer: Where friendships go to die, and not in the good, competitive way. 
Innovation: EA certainly tried something new on legendary C&C.

If you enjoy nostalgia trips that end in â€œWhat have they done to my game?!â€, then C&C4 is a must-not-play. Itâ€™s like ordering a pizza and getting a salad; itâ€™s not what you wanted, and itâ€™s definitely not what you expected.

Oh, and yeah. It can't even start sometimes lol

column9:
What an amazing game! It's a shame they didn't use its full potential for a truly masterful conclusion to the saga. After the third installment, everything was set up for at least one of the most brutal and epic campaigns imaginable. Still, it's a fantastic game, I have so many memories of it, and the soundtrack is absolutely beautiful.
Greetings to everyone reading this from Argentina, and have a great time!

column8: So one of the 1st pc games i ever played was c&c red alert 2 got hooked then on to yuris revenge and looked forward to generals and zero hour. When this game came out in 2010 i bought it for myself for my birthday and then my laptop crapped out on me the 1st time i opened the game, blamed ea and didnt get another comp for a couple years, forgot all about c&c 4, then i was into sim city and on to cities skylines. I picked this game up in the $10 bundle here on steam and decided to finally give it a try after getting all nostalgic over red alert 2 and trying red alert 3. So here i am giving history of times long passed and reading negative reviews of c&c 4 but i have to say i actually like it. No its not like the other cookie cutter versions of rts and it has a hole new mechanic of field control. I played gens and 0hr for years online and it was nearly all the same thing, who could amass the largest army the fastest and it was just unit spam. This game i feel takes more strategy and alleviates that unit spam. Yes it is different from the other c&c and other rts but if you give it an honest try (i suggest doing the story line so you learn these new mechanics) i think you too would actually enjoy it. yes i had issues logging in and yes i also had the general system error when i first opened the game and tried like 15x, went to discussion and typed out my agitation and walked away for 10min. Came back and decided to try one more time and hey it worked have to sign in 2x which doesnt make since but it works and now im 6hr in and enjoying a game i payed full price for 14years ago and had to buy again in a bundle. but whatever give it a try DO THE STORY LINE 1ST!!!!

column8:
Recommended. Not for the game is a good one itself, but it makes you think about "how could a legendary franchise die".
Story is cringe, gameplay is okay, Scrin is completely gone for some reason.
Anyway, it's uncanon, but still enjoyable for about a few hours I guess? Play it first to appreciate the rest of this lineup.

The login issue ("General System Error") can be solved by opening EA Origin in your browser and login there first, then launching the game.
You'll need to login again once you pass the first one. This one might randomly block your login for a few times but eventually you'll get in.

column8:
After playing the game for a bit less than 2 hours I must say.
CnC 4 does not exist.
The game is a soulless attempt of EA milk the game series for the very last buck.
Base Building, the core of CnC games? Removed.
Resource management? Removed.
Instead we got a command point system that strongly reminds of Arena Wars.
In fact. This game is just a glorified Arena Wars with storyline.
To top it off the graphics are a clear downgrade from Tiberium Wars and Kane's Wrath. Which is quite a bummer considering how long after those this game got released.
I only got this game because it was in the pack with all other CnC games for 10â‚¬ total. So you could say I got this game for free. Considering how much I love the CnC series and how little I liked this game. Even 1.50 â‚¬ would be overpaying for this game.
And even then. Even if gained for free. The 6.4 GB it uses on your disc is just wasted space.
This much of a disappointment the game is to me.

Have The Utimate Collection and got this one to work too. How? Look at your ea-account. Go to Connections-tab and see if you have a link to Steam if not make it so. Start game. Enter your ea-account and click Login. Not working try it again and again....
Succeed? Create persona click Play and wait. After intro you have to login with your ea-account again.
Next time you see the persona in the Commander List.
I played a few missions, it looks great. Graphics to the max and resolution too.
You can also play online. Will it work tomorrow  and the day after .......
For now it's OK.

I canâ€™t believe myself, I let EA f**k me over once again. This is so typical EA now grasps for straws, releasing games that arenâ€™t finished or as in this case, classic games with no modern system update or servers that have been shut down rendering the game completely unplayable.

This was the final straw for me however, I am done with EA. This will be the last game/bundle I will ever buy from EA as a publisher. They are a greedy company on a downfall, they know this and are trying to sell old (in some cases free) games now without updating them or making sure they work on modern systems.

It was a good run EA, but enough is enough and I am setting my foot down now. The C&C series was my childhood and you just ruined it.

column8:
I figured to give this game a fair shake as I never really played it before unlike the previous games. Oh god they are all right for the most part!!!
[olist]
[*]I needed to bring down my password length because EA did not know how to make a good login system back in the day. This game has a max length in the password fields.
[*]You need to log in 2x just to play. First time is in the "Launcher" and the second is in game. And there is no save password feature.
[*]Good luck actually getting in game. think I got in 1/4 times I tried during different parts of the day.
[*]The units look like garbage. I think they were going after the RA3 vibe but without the charm.
[*]Game play is zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz
[*]Stupid progression system is a turn off. Campaign does not progress you at all.
[*] LIKE WTF is this game play!
[/olist]
But Kane is cool!

Ah yes, the much maligned final main entry to the Command and Conquer series that started from 1995. In a nutshell, I really do not consider this to be a good entry in the series, much alone a game on its own. In a word, they f***ed this up.

Quick history about this title: This game was supposed to be a C&C game originally tailored for the Asian market, sort of a spin-off sorts with fast-paced battles and persistent online. However, in EA's infinite wisdom decided to make this into the next mainline entry to C&C and you can clearly see how that turned out.

First, the bad: Biggest one, there is no base building. Absolute heresy to me considering this is a C&C title, even their last big title Red Alert 3 stuck to the ways of the MCV! 

Second, the always online requirement. You need to be online to play this game, even in single player missions. This to me makes no sense if you do not intend to play multiplayer as when the servers eventually go offline, you have no way to play this game! 

Third, the intended design of this game. This game is heavily reliant on rush tactics, even if you play defense class. Since your MCV is the only major building you have to take care of, turtling tactics are not an option.. Plus, there's a unit cap which is also silly in a C&C game. 

Fourth, the storyline. Oh boy, did they screw this one up bad. Not spoiling anything but this game ignores a major plot point in C&C 3 which completely changes how the story progresses. Honestly, only the cutscenes with Kane are the only thing that saves this from being utterly forgettable, but even then it feels like the whole thing was rushed.

There are some good things I can say about this game. Firstly, the music. While not appropriate for a C&C game (lots of orchestral music), it does provide some semblance of competency for each track composed.

Second, the graphics. Ignoring the downgraded sound design (which seems to be lacking from C&C 3), the graphics do have the visual flair from what I assume is an upgraded engine from what EA has been using from Red Alert 3 and C&C 3. There seems to be some effort to really step up the graphics from all the previous games, shame that it's basically squandered here.

There is a reason a lot of fans consider C&C 4 to not be the conclusive ending to this great series and I do not recommend you go out of your way to play this game unless you're willing to deal with the always-online requirement and a sub-par storyline. Multiplayer may be fun at times if you know what to expect, but there are way better games that do this kind of gameplay. Unless you're here because of the bundle for all the other C&C games then in that case, understandable.

Das Spiel startet prinzipiell und ich konnte den Einzelspieler Modus starten. Bis ich dort war, musste man erst mal Unsinn durchmachen. Beim Startet soll man sich Einloggen. Also Daten eingegeben und einen Fehler bekommen. Das passierte immer! Dann hatte ich mal anstelle der Mail den Benutzernamen versucht und entsprechend einen Fehler bekommen das es sich hier ja nicht um eine Mail handle. Also wieder die Mail benutzt und plÃ¶tzlich ging es. 
Das Spiel ist dann gestartet und ich musste mich noch mal einloggen .... Das Spiel startet dann mit 800x600 AuflÃ¶sung und muss erst mal umgestellt werden. 
Matchmakting fÃ¼r PVE hatte nicht funktioniert, in der Lobby waren User aber vielleicht hatte nur keiner ebenfalls ein Spiel gesucht, man mÃ¼sste das noch mal weiter testen. 
Wie schon geschrieben, ein Single Player Spiel konnte ich starten.

EA, es ist schÃ¶n das ihr die Alten Spiele wieder auf den markt direkt in Steam bringt, aber man hÃ¤tte immerhin ein Minimum an Arbeit rein stecken kÃ¶nnen und das ganze reibungsloser machen kÃ¶nnen.
column9:
The game basically starts, and I was able to launch the single-player mode. However, getting there was a real hassle. Upon launching, it prompts you to log in. So I entered my credentials and received an error message. This happened every time! Then, instead of my email address, I tried my username and got another error message saying it wasn't an email address. So I used my email address again, and suddenly it worked.

The game then launched, and I had to log in again... The game then starts with an 800x600 resolution and needs to be adjusted.

Matchmaking for PvE didn't work; there were users in the lobby, but perhaps no one else was looking for a game. This needs further testing.

As I mentioned, I was able to launch a single-player game.

EA, it's great that you're bringing the old games back to the market directly on Steam, but you could have at least put in a minimum of effort to make the whole process smoother.

column9:
The most controversial of all the C&C games due to its new gameplay style. Units are limited, there's no building as such, and there's no soundtrack by Frank Klepacki (which, by the way, was still pretty good, a sort of reworking of the classics).
I also didn't like the addition of classes (three each for GDI and Nod: defensive, offensive, and support, with each class having its own units). Because of this, you can't change tactics at any opportunity during the game, which seemed to greatly limit gameplay variety.

The gameplay was designed for co-op, but you could also play it with a computer, which was the case the first time around when the game was released. I played it with a friend the second time, which made it a bit more interesting, even though I finished it almost immediately after the first time.

I liked the overall story, but since the majority of the game is gameplay, it wasn't particularly engaging.

I really liked the production quality of the cutscenes, which weren't shot with a tripod, as usual. However, the final cutscenes with the white background looked a bit dubious and odd, I remember. And the actresses in this part aren't particularly interesting, if you know what I mean.

5 successful Kane ascensions out of 10.

P.S. I recently rewatched all the videos on YouTube and I can say that they're more interesting than before. There's more action and less tripod-based filming. The only downside is that there aren't many computer-generated cinematic cutscenes and the lack of beautiful actresses like before. I also liked Kane's Russian voice acting in C&C 3 better.

column8: This could have been a good game but its obvious that EA did not throw enough money on development while setting it up as a esports title. Its just another IP that died on the altar of esports like Dawn of War. If they kept the C&C base building and the walkers were just another limited unit then it would have been a good game.  With some balance changes. The walker only arenas could have been just a mode for multiplayer/skirmish but no, its all you get. A lot of units but whats the point of that when they are just skins that modtly serve the same pourpose for each walker? The fact you have to unlock units and abilities through leveling is just idiotic, the impact of the walker in the early lvls is almost none, just a mobile factory making the game boring and tedious. But hey thats what everyone loves in order to play the full game roster you need to grind like a moron for hours. Just a shame, EA released C&C3, Red Alert 3 and Generals which were good games but why the hell did they pivot to this I have no idea. The game is not horrible just you wont enjoy it untiill you unlock some abilities and vent hen its just ok.

column9:
Give him a reason, and he can disband the studio players have been longing for. Give him a 17th anniversary, and he can continue to profit from the studio he himself disbanded. On March 8, 2023, EA abruptly released the Command & Conquer: The Final Collection. This immediately attracted widespread attention from players worldwide, with many spending money to support Westwood Studios' Cyberpunk franchise. The result? The game received was of prehistoric resolution, with utterly unimproved optimization that sent players back to their childhood. Even Red Alert 2 couldn't be purchased separately; the entire collection had to be bought. And Tiberium Twilight was a complete mess, with a login screen that hadn't been updated in over a decade, demonstrating EA's lack of conscience in this move.

[b]Even General MacArthur said, "If the US military used Tiberium Twilight for training, then the recruits would be stuck on the login screen."[/b]

So, what kind of company is EA, and why did they act so abruptly on their 17th anniversary?

[h1]The epic documentary "Command & Conquer: The Final Collection" continues to air.[/h1]

column9:
This game is garbage.

It's been 14 years since your game was released, and you're still making it constantly online? Are you out of your mind?

I just wanted to play through the story, but all I got was disconnects, disconnects, and more disconnects. I'm not even playing online, is it really necessary?

Then I realized that many units require grinding to unlock. Seriously, this game is ridiculous.

It's so hard to even find a VPN for this crappy game.

It's making me laugh in frustration.

column9:
The gameplay is so complicated that I won't repeat it here.
It forces an internet connection; without one, your campaign progress won't be saved.
It has an overpowered launcher with dual login; you have to enter your password twice to open the game.

column8:
EA included this in the new Command & Conquer Ultimate Collection where the beloved series of C&C games are now available on Steam, this game however is the parasite latched on to that bundle. 

The rest of the C&C games do not require you to run the EA app or login to an EA account, this one however will only work if you log in to that EA account you probably forgot about. 

Fuck you EA eat a dick.

column8:
Is it playable as of the 10th March 2024? Yes, it is. There are issues with the login servers so much so that I get in on my first try sometimes and sometimes I have to hack in my password for 10 min. Once you are in, it's all working. It's not great but it's workable for such an old game.

For the game itself. It's not a great RTS but you probably already knew that. What it has going for it is Joseph David Kucan aka Kane ... and with him the conclusion of the Tiberium story arch. For fans of the series it is worth playing through the campaign to experience the story ... in particular as going forward everyone would have got this through the ultimate edition sort of "for free"
column9:

column8:
I've been a big fan of C&C games. Growing up seeing this game as a canon continuation of an absolute gem C&C3 was, I sometimes wonder how harder a franchise can screw up... And then I remember C&C4!

Only reason I bought it was because it was included in the dirt cheap bundle of my favourite C&C titles. I could be happy even if this was excluded.

Strongly non recommended - thumbs down

In the tank mission, even enemy engineers couldn't penetrate the tanks. Offensive bases were basically helpless, watching as enemy engineers endured heavy fire to force vehicle trades. Even worse, after a vehicle exploded, the enemy engineers could respawn intact and continue trading, even with three-star vehicles, regardless of armor type â€“ they were just easy targets.

In defensive mode, bunkers were like paper in front of enemy vehicles, easily destroyed by machine guns. The armored vehicles given in the mission took over ten rounds to destroy the enemy humanoid mechs, while the enemy engineers continued to endure the fire to trade vehicles. The three-star humanoid mechs they had stockpiled had no room to deal damage; the squad of three-star infantry they kept to clear the enemy engineers were instantly wiped out by the enemy flamethrowersâ€¦

In the spaceship crash mission, no matter what units they deployed, they couldn't out-trade the enemy. Finally, they had to defend the mutant facility, spawning suicide bombers to brute force their way through and destroy two enemy bases. The 50-energy defensive structures couldn't stop three enemy units from occupying buildingsâ€¦ The next squad of infantry was wiped out in five seconds, so they immediately sent reinforcements to mass-produce engineers and hold the wreckage, finally thwarting the enemy's baseless assault. Then the enemy base spawned engineers and I was wiped out...
I looked for guides online...wait, where did the mammoths come from?

I went outside and found out the technology doesn't unlock with missions, it's globally locked. You have to grind game levels, and without levels, you only have the same units in every mode...GDINOD requires separate grinding, and there's a population cap... With the global lock, you can only grind by playing more skirmishes, but the skirmish population cap is 80 and the campaign population cap is 50... With the global lock, I get destroyed in campaigns and can only upgrade to Tier 2, and even then, there's no technology unlocking.

I really don't want to grind with the global lock, so I'm thinking of just watching the story online.

I can feel my lack of skill in StarCraft, but I can easily beat hard in COD3. In this game's easy mode, I only feel like I'm playing against bots with bricks. If I don't want to grind, I can only shrug.

I curse your horse, EA! What RTS game requires a constant internet connection? Even if it's online, the servers are worse than my grandma's simmered pig's trotters. And then there's the double login! Playing single-player campaigns is a nightmare, constantly disconnecting and losing progress.

You're on Steam now, all you care about is making money, completely ignoring the gaming experience modern games should have, right? No optimizations or improvements whatsoever? You don't treat players like human beings, but like cash cows and money-making tools, right?

And you're forcing bundled sales! If it weren't for Red Alert 2, I'd rather pay a dog than buy this garbage.

Oh, you damn EA, you rotten piece of trash! You're just like Activision Blizzard, those two are like the Crouching Dragon and the Young Phoenix, all they have are top-tier IPs and they don't do anything useful. You're arguably the two worst game companies in the world. Tencent and NetEase are a million times better than you! Ubisoft's canned games are a billion times more fun than this pure industrial garbage!

Buying this piece of crap from you will only pollute my inventory and my computer!

column8:
I'm not leaving a positive review for a shit game. I'm giving you guys something positive. 
And plus it's free and not a scam.

[u][b][h1] Chicken Pot Pie Soup [/h1][/b][/u]


[b][h1] Ingredients [/h1][/b]
[list]
[*]1/4 cup vegetable oil, divided
[*]4 to 6 bone-in, skin on chicken thighs
[*]1 teaspoon all-purpose seasoning, plus more as needed
[*]1 large yellow onion, chopped
[*]2 stalks celery, chopped
[*]4 carrots, cut into bite-sized pieces
[*]2 cloves garlic, chopped
[*]1 cup mushrooms, cut into bite-sized pieces
[*]1 cube chicken bouillon, or more to taste
[*]2 teaspoons dried rosemary
[*]1/4 cup all-purpose flour
[*]1 (12 ounce) bag mixed frozen vegetables
[*]4 cups chicken stock, or more as needed
[*]1 cup heavy cream or half-and-half
[/list]

[b][h1][u]Directions[/u][/h1][/b]

[b]Step 1[/b]
Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a Dutch oven or large cast iron skillet over medium heat. Pat chicken dry with a paper towel and season to taste with all-purpose seasoning.

[b]Step 2[/b]
Cook chicken thighs in the hot oil until browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer chicken to a platter to cool.

[b]Step 3[/b]
Add onions, celery, carrots, and garlic to the remaining oil in the Dutch oven (add 1 tablespoon more oil if needed). Season mixture with 1 teaspoon all-purpose seasoning to layer the flavor. Cook and stir until onions begin to turn translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.

[b]Step 4[/b]
Add mushrooms, chicken bouillon cube, and dried rosemary. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Whisk in flour; cook for 1 to 2 minutes.

[b]Step 5[/b]
Slowly whisk in chicken stock. Bring to a simmer and continue stirring until flour is well mixed into stock. Cook, stirring constantly, until soup begins to thicken. Depending on how thick you would like your soup, you may need to add a little more stock.

[b]Step 6[/b]
Meanwhile, remove skin from chicken thighs, pull the meat apart, and add to the pot. Continue to stir for 1 minute. Cover and cook at a low simmer for 10 to 12 minutes.

[b]Step 7[/b]
Add frozen vegetables; stir and reduce heat. Pour in heavy cream and stir well to blend in the cream. Cover, and return soup to a simmer, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat, stir, and serve immediately.
