* in the end of 2021 they have removed CnC4 from Steam Store, so I can play it and you can only read this review.

CnC4: Tiberian Twilight is Quake III Arena or the Unreal Tournament of RTS: It's title should be 'CnC: Tiberian Arena' or similar. Without that '4' in it. Otherwise it's everything OK with this game, all the negativity is the weird society reaction that should not be.

My only warning for those who are willing to play classic RTS with the multiple buildings at base: there is only a single walking 2-in-1 mobile construction vehicle and factory - the crawler - that is all your base in Tiberian Twilight (but also you will be able to build some defensive turrets), Instead of repetitive 'Game over / Loading' you'll get a new crawler from the orbit if the previous is lost. You'll realize this is a good decision for a multiplayer oriented gameplay. Remember: this is actually CnC: Tiberian Arena.

What is special about Tiberian Twilight:

- network oriented gamplay: teamwork/cooperative, deathmatch (there's still a small singleplayer campaign)

- quality over quantity: you can't build hundreds of units (there are points as a limit system, their maximum depends on player's profile level) so you really have to be more tactical, keep them alive so they become veterans, use their special abilities

- for every next crawler you able to choose its type (offensive/defensive/support), so there's more sense in cooperation between players

- no bugs

- unfortunately you must also have EA account to launch the game.

And for every developer: don't use the word 'Twilight' in your title.

This is the sad ending to a great franchise, purchase it only for the story and Kane when in serious discount. The gameplay is not  exactly a thrill with mostly doing the same things over and over even if missions are different type.

One thing in the game is interesting in comparison to the regular old fashioned c&c, the mobile headquarter types having different units. I think this is the only interesting aspect of the gameplay.

column8:
Do not waste your time on this game.

A shit closure to one of the best RTS games.

It deserved better, just watch the cutscenes on YouTube or something. 

Gameplay is nothing like any of the other Command and Conquer games, they threw out everything that was this franchise and basically tried something that failed miserably.

Can't wait for the remake of Tiberian Dawn at least that will be better than this trash.

column8: El juego con el que EA empezo a ser EA.

Big Rigs over the Road Racing is better than this game.

Even my laptop decided to overheat when I was just curious about how bad a game could be.

I almost lost faith in myself, I thought I was mentally challenged because I was having difficulty finishing the first non-tutorial level.

After like 2 hours attempts (with several reboots on the way), I finally managed to beat it by chance, and later I realized that I actually need to grind and level up to that my armies are actually stronger.

Yep, I pretty much F2Aed the second run.

Big Rigs over the Road Racing is better than this game.

Even my laptop decided to overheat when I was just curious about how bad a game could be.

I almost lost faith in myself, I thought I was mentally challenged because I was having difficulty finishing the first non-tutorial level.

After like 2 hours attempts (with several reboots on the way), I finally managed to beat it by chance, and later I realized that I actually need to grind and level up to that my armies are actually stronger.

Yep, I pretty much F2Aed the second run.

English (translated with google):
Unfortunately, anything but Command & Conquer! Even the stupid registration via an account is annoying! If only it would work. I saw about 2% of the game, then I had to reinstall my PC due to a system crash and since then I have not been able to log in because my account is already taken! It doesn't matter at all that I have the right passwords and user names, the system doesn't accept access.
When I asked support, as is always to be expected with Electronic Arts, there was no answer at first and after a long time of pestering me, I was simply told that it was probably a local problem and that I should just buy the game again!
So typical ElectronicArts. The main thing is to take money out of your pocket and not have to deliver anything in return. Cheeky!
This filthy publisher and game studio destroyer should be closed down by the state and the UN, the management staff expropriated and sentenced to a lifetime of forced gaming of the pearls of the gaming world that they themselves defaced.
What I was able to see during the only access I've had so far was anything but convincing. This crawler principle seems to be anything but convincing, but as I said, since I can't access it, further analysis is unfortunately out of the question. ElectronicArts can go to hell!

Unfortunately, people ... they simply do not know what to do, like a herd of gazelles...
And yes, you can activate and play this game. 
Just click on this link: https://account.origin.com/cp-ui/redemption/index, and activate your code on the EA homepage. 
Then just log in to the C&C 4 client with your EA account and you're done.

column8:
+ runs well on older computers
- too shallow for an MMO game
- too shallow for a C&C game

TL,DR: just leave it alone. Really, don't bother

This game is marred by bad design from the start.
 
It forces you to play online, YET it won't start, unless you log onto Origin, and add your CD key. Even after that, you must make numerous login attempts to play.

It forces you to play single player campaign, YET the story is a complete mess. I never felt so disappointed in my life playing a C&C campaign. Reading the reviews I thought it can't be that bad. Guess what, it's worse... Just watch the outro video on YT, and you'll see what I mean.

It tries to be c&c only in its name. It is basically a small-squad-tactics game, sprinkled with minimal special abilities for units. Oh, and said units are boring as HELL. I have 12 hours behind my back, but I couldn't tell the difference between a Zone Trooper and a Zone Enforcer with a gun at my head.

It attempts to be the herald on the MMO era with its "fast" pace, but it also falls flat. Dammit, who designed the hotkeys? SHIFT+F5 for a unit construction? Geez... Also, even basic design attempts are failing. Like, I delpoy a Zone Lancer gunner, and then select a new one by double-clicking on it. If I press the deploy hotkey, the newly selected ones deploy, while the deployed ones undeploy... good luck managing that in the midst of battle.

All in all, be glad if you couldn't start that one - nothing can give you back the time you would've wasted on that garbage.

- I know it is different from any other game of the franchise. I know that you cannot build vast armies and play the classical RTS. I know this game was the black sheep of the franchise and that it practically killed it.
- Well, after almost 10 years of bad RTS games or no RTS games available at all on the gaming market, I replayed all the series of Command & Conquer and I must say I truly enjoyed playing them for like the seventh time. I could never get from any other recent RTS the same exceptionally good feeling I got in the C&C or Starcraft series.
- If you played the rest of the games in the franchise, you will find this one disconcerting and strange, because the game mechanics are not at all what are you used to.
- Nevertheless, once you master the new mechanisms and accept the fact that spots holding and points counting will make the game shorter than expected or desired, you can still have fun in the game.
- The joy I received from the franchise over the years is the only reason I gave C&C 4 a thumbs-up, since this game had a very unfortunate fate due to the mixed-up system they changed instead of keeping the good old (and proved) game mechanics in the series.
- Still, for an RTS fan, the game was  a must-play marker and can still be enjoyed even in 4K.

- I know it is different from any other game of the franchise. I know that you cannot build vast armies and play the classical RTS. I know this game was the black sheep of the franchise and that it practically killed it.
- Well, after almost 10 years of bad RTS games or no RTS games available at all on the gaming market, I replayed all the series of Command & Conquer and I must say I truly enjoyed playing them for like the seventh time. I could never get from any other recent RTS the same exceptionally good feeling I got in the C&C or Starcraft series.
- If you played the rest of the games in the franchise, you will find this one disconcerting and strange, because the game mechanics are not at all what are you used to.
- Nevertheless, once you master the new mechanisms and accept the fact that spots holding and points counting will make the game shorter than expected or desired, you can still have fun in the game.
- The joy I received from the franchise over the years is the only reason I gave C&C 4 a thumbs-up, since this game had a very unfortunate fate due to the mixed-up system they changed instead of keeping the good old (and proved) game mechanics in the series.
- Still, for an RTS fan, the game was  a must-play marker and can still be enjoyed even in 4K.

column8:
The game has some sort of copy protection where you need to stay connected to the EA games server.
Needless to say, it doesn't. 
A popup message will say that further progress (while in the middle of a level), will be saved and you need to reconnect and reaload. 
If you don't, progress is not saved. And yes, this is single player I'm talking about.

You could see this as an added difficulty, but for me this was the last C&C I have bought from EA Games.
..kinda only bought it for the Westwood memory anyway, which I knew already is long gone.

Oh, the game itself isn't that great either. I'd rather re-buy Red Alert 1 and I would've had more fun.

Do not buy.

column8:
While the game looks and sounds great, it's not Command & Conquer, not on any level is this a C&C game. Feels more like a RTT then a, RTS. I got it on sale for $4.99USD and I still feel let down... 

The sad part is, this was the end to our beloved Tiberium universe and it's a shameful display of EA's greed and bloated gluttony. Shame on you EA, shame on you for doing this to fans that have been following Command & Conquer since 1995 and then try to pose this crap as a Command & Conquer game.

Feel free to leave comments below on what you think should be done about C&C 4.

Do not buy this product! especially if you considering buying the bundle with hopes of playing Command & Conquer 4.
I bought the bundle and put in over 20 hours in Red Alert 3 only, and then realized when installing Command & Conquer 4 that the key for it doesn't work.
If you put in more than 2 hours in any one of the games offered in the bundle, Steam will not refund you for command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight, instead are happy to provide a non functional game.

Obwohl dieses Spiel so anders ist als die anderen Teile der C&C Reihe (nur auf PC bezogen) hat dieses Spiel doch etwas an sich dass man es nach ein paar Jahren wieder aus der Versenkung hervor holt und noch einmal Spielen mÃ¶chte, wÃ¤hre da nicht eine gewisse zusÃ¤tzliche Online Registrierung die, nachdem man sein Konto angelegt hat bzw. sich mit seinen alten Daten Eingeloggt hat, einen RegistrierungsschlÃ¼ssel verlangt der trotz mehrmaliger Eingabe nicht mehr Funktioniert.

Steam bietet in diesem Fall keine Hilfe und verweist auf den EA Kundensupport der den Support fÃ¼r genau dieses Game Eingestellt zu haben scheint, somit ist es nicht mÃ¶glich dieses Game auf legalem weg zu Spielen, ein Keygenerator kÃ¶nnte hier vermutlich Abhilfe schaffen, aber da ich solche Programme nicht nutze bleibt dieses Spiel wohl fÃ¼r immer ausserhalb meiner Reichweite.

Edit: Habe das Problem mit dem nicht Funktionierendem Key gelÃ¶st, Ihr mÃ¼sst euch Ã¼ber euren Browser in euer bereits bestehendes EA Konto Einloggen oder ein Konto erÃ¶ffnen,          

Ihr klickt dann folgendes: Konto Verwalten ---> Code EinlÃ¶sen, jetzt den Code hier Eintippen oder Reinkopieren,  Wiedeholt auf next klicken bis Key Akzeptiert wurde.

Steam Starten (wenn bereits aktiviert dann neustart machen), C&C4 starten und im folgenden EA Bildschirm normal Einloggen und dann spiel Starten ohne den Key erneut eingeben zu mÃ¼ssen, fertig ;)

Der Daumen bleibt aber trotzdem unten weil C&C4 fÃ¼r mich das schlechteste aus der ganzen Reihe ist, und es keinen Neutralen Daumen gibt :D

column8:
I have encountered quite a lot of technical issues (even with click and drag, logging in issues) with this and am totally unimpressed with the the story line, which is unengaging to say the least. However, my greatest disappointment is with the gameplay.

1. Limited population - you can only build 6-7 medium units + 2-4 engineers for repairs. By no means are you able to fully balance out your units and deploy your strategy effectively and every battle becomes a micro management nightmare.

2. Lack of resouce management - to me part of the beauty of past C&C (or any RTS for that matter) is the effective use of limited resource. In this game, you are given unlimited resource to build any amount of units, only constraint being the miserable pop cap in point 1. Half the time in this game you are just spamming cheap cannon fodder units without a care to their surviveabilty.

3. MCV - 3 MCV types that you have to select at start of game and each with their specific units / buildings. For example, you can only build defensive structure if you select the defense MCV and only tank units if you select the offense MCV. To change MCV type mid game you have to basically deconstruct your existing MCV and select a new type. And you can only land it on specific zones! This is a major PITA for me, why can't we have the option to build up my base defense even if my strategy is tank based? 

4. Upgrade path - you can only gain access to certain units / abilities after leveling up and even at end game stage you will not have access to the best units / abilities, even after finishing all the side quests. While this by no means stops you from completing the game, it does not offer you the best experience (unless you are willing to replay completed missions to earn extra exp). The best example is perhaps the final mission for NOD, where you have to destroy a GDI battleship, which basically 2 hits all your basic units. I remember spamming the basic units till the miserable pop cap, watching them shave 4-5%  off the GDI battleship and then dying in less than 3 sec, and then repeat ad naseum.

Overall, this game seems to be a weak & sad attempt by EA to milk a dying cow and is an utter embarrassment to the original C&C.
column9:

In this game, you are given unlimited resource to build any amount of units, only constraint being the miserable pop cap in point 1. Half the time in this game you are just spamming cheap cannon fodder units without a care to their surviveabilty.

3. MCV - 3 MCV types that you have to select at start of game and each with their specific units / buildings. While this by no means stops you from completing the game, it does not offer you the best experience (unless you are willing to replay completed missions to earn extra exp). I remember spamming the basic units till the miserable pop cap, watching them shave 4-5%  off the GDI battleship and then dying in less than 3 sec, and then repeat ad naseum.

column8:
So, I remember when I was hyped for C&C4, and when I finally got to play it, I felt like I had Cloud's sword stabbed into my back. This isn't even worthy of being part of the series, like you choose out of 3 MCVs to start with and you have Offense, Support and Defence. Naturally I wanted to dive in so I chose Offense, and I felt just as confused as an illegal immigrant waking up in the middle of America. I didn't know anything about the units or base building, so I noticed I could create an engineer and so my first thought was "ok progress". No, they can't construct buildings, but they can repair units and use basic attacks to defend themselves. There's an upgrades tab that I didn't know how to unlock the technology to research passive abilities or even new units. 
After a while I began to feel like some sort of dictator trying to make shit work after it's too late. If anything I'd just stick with Kanes Wrath or Red Alert 3, in fact just play anything before them, don't touch that free browser shit or number 4, stick to the classics.
column9:

Death of a great game series.  I think the fact that they rushed the game development; and then. announced that they wanted player input as how to make the next game better.  Then EA dissolves the development team.  C&C games are still being played by millions of gamers, and with the expansion of available MODS (recently ever more great ones!) the gamer base is growing.  C&C Generals Zero Hour seems really hot (many mod users playing on-line).  Maybe EA should hire the modders to make new games for them, or redesign the old ones and release them on their own.

column8:
A usual C&C games, for the oldies nostalgy.

The game introduce some new concepts though, with 3 different types of base 8offense, defense and support9m somehow forcing you to adapt to the battlefield conditions as each type can produce specific units.

The base are also mobile so it can bring another level to the fight.

Gameplay wise, apart from the above, it's quite the same as the old C&C but you don't gather tiberium anymore.

So you build your base, some units and you rush to the ennemy.

The scenario is quite classical, but still, it's fun to see some games running real videos with actors to move forward with the scenario.

Graphically speaking, it's quite ok, nothing fantastic but still nice to look at.

There are obviously nowadays better alternatives, but if you want to finish the C&C story, go for it.

column8: Pessimo, nÃ£o tem nada haver com a franquia, o que era um RTS, virou um dominaÃ§Ã£o de ponto, enjoativo facilmente.

Tags: RTS - Real Time Strategy
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Streamline-a-RTS formula that has you control checkpoints with mobile fast paced combat oriented squads with mobile buildings that spawn units. Could not get past DRM/EA account login. 

I believe I might have tried it for a very short time and did not like the new approach one bit. If anything I'd rather go the opposite direction and focus on basebuilding instead like Factoria proposes.

In any case I retested this year created a new EA account. They have not sent anything to my inbox and using the username and password I had just created said the password was invalid. 

At a loss at how to proceed forward but I have a lot of quality RTS. Factorio, Starcraft 2, Ashes of singularity to name a few. This botched attempt at changing an established formula will not be missed. Removed permanently into hidden library of titles for declutter.

I kinda like it. 

Been playing C&C since 98. Tiberian Twilight since it came out. Glad to find it on steam. 

I don't have the time to game I used to. Short campaign with some interesting twists. Childish, A-Move to victory gameplay. Joe Kucan putting in work. It's all I need on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Or to co-op with friends. I come back to this more than any other C&C title.

But recommend it? EA didn't believe in this game and you can tell. Tiberium 3 and Red Alert 3 had Hollywood names. Full length campaigns. Polished multiplayer to rival StarCraft. An archive full of world lore. They were labours of love. By comparison, 4 was a paycheck. Why should I ask you to shell out money for it? Tib 3 & RA3 are on steam as well, selling for a third less I might add.

Horrible. Este juego no es un Command & Conquer. Tiene la complejidad de un juego de telÃ©fono mÃ³vil. 
Lo han simplificado al mÃ¡ximo. No puedes construir bases. No hay cosechadoras. 

Como no hay bases, no hay planificaciÃ³n, asÃ­ que todas las misiones se reducen a dos tipos: escoltar/proteger o  atacar con lÃ­mite de tiempo.  

Como no hay cosechadoras, no hay gestiÃ³n de recursos, asÃ­ que le han puesto lÃ­mite de unidades (unas 10 a la vez o asÃ­), de tal forma que siempre construyes gratis, pero no puedes pasar de tener un reducido nÃºmero de unidades. El jugador del ordenador durante la campaÃ±a por supuesto no tiene lÃ­mite y puede tener todas las que quiera.

Le han quitado todas las cosas que definÃ­an a la saga.Esto es como si al Mario le meten contenido para adultos. A saber en quÃ© estaban pensando los desarrolladores al crear este engendro. Da la impresiÃ³n de que intentaron copiarse del Company of Heroes y al final ni lo uno ni lo otro. EstÃ¡ tan mal hecho que no harÃ­an falta mÃ¡s excusas para despedir a todos los que hayan tomado las decisiones de hacerlo asÃ­.

Y para colmo te obliga a estar siempre conectado a internet. Este es otro juego mÃ¡s que pareciera como si lo hubieran querido sabotear desde dentro. El Ãºnico sentido que tiene jugar a esto es que hayas jugado a todos los anteriores y quieras ver como termina la historia. Ponerlo en nivel fÃ¡cil y pasarlo cuanto antes.
Aunque claro, tambiÃ©n puedes verlo por youtube y te ahorras el tener que comprarlo.

column8: Bevor ich das Spiel Ã¼berhaupt beginnen darf soll ich einen EA account einrichten. Da EA aber immer mehr den bach runtergeht, und seit ca. 10 Jahren nichts gutes mehr gebracht hat vertraue ich deisem Konzern sicher keine Daten an. Ich rate dringend vom kauf ab!

8 years after the fact I know the meaning of futility.  

After installing and jumping through the account hoops to even play, then having an argument with windows firewall, I finally got into the game.

I chose to do a skirmish first as I hear the campaign is a testicular ache without a bit of grind first.  During said skirmish I got a disconnect message.  Tabbed out to see if it was my actual connection, it was not.

Now here's the thing, after a 40 minute slog it decided absolutely nothing I did counted.  About 600+ XP up in smoke.

Turns out it doesn't bother reconnecting itself.  In a MUST BE ONLINE TO SAVE game this is unforgivable.

Gameplay is done better by Relics Company of Heroes/ DoW 2 series.  Certainly not traditional C&C which I could forgive if it was good on it's own.  It's passable at best.

No idea on story as it's unlikely I'll be playing again.

Graphics are essentially upgraded C&C 3 visuals, they're passable.

Music is terrible.

This is the fastest fornicate this poop I've ever done in a videogame.  Well done EA.  This was a Â£2 purchase BTW.  I still feel ripped off.

Tl;dr review:  Several asterisks worth of less than complimentary language describe my feelings of about the game.
column9:
8 years after the fact I know the meaning of futility.  

After installing and jumping through the account hoops to even play, then having an argument with windows firewall, I finally got into the game.

I chose to do a skirmish first as I hear the campaign is a testicular ache without a bit of grind first.  During said skirmish I got a disconnect message.  Tabbed out to see if it was my actual connection, it was not.

Now here's the thing, after a 40 minute slog it decided absolutely nothing I did counted.  About 600+ XP up in smoke.

Turns out it doesn't bother reconnecting itself.  In a MUST BE ONLINE TO SAVE game this is unforgivable.

Gameplay is done better by Relics Company of Heroes/ DoW 2 series.  Certainly not traditional C&C which I could forgive if it was good on it's own.  It's passable at best.

No idea on story as it's unlikely I'll be playing again.

Graphics are essentially upgraded C&C 3 visuals, they're passable.

Music is terrible.

This is the fastest fornicate this poop I've ever done in a videogame.  Well done EA.  This was a Â£2 purchase BTW.  I still feel ripped off.

Tl;dr review:  Several asterisks worth of less than complimentary language describe my feelings of about the game.

I got this game thinking that it would be fun, but boy was I wrong. I never even finished the campaign and I HATE this game already. The first C&C that I played was C&C Generals and its expansion Zero Hour, and I fell in love with it rate of the bat, but now C&C is in the deep end. If another installment is ever releases I hope that EA will fix their mess up and bring a great game franchises back from the grave.

Ich habe mich auf das Spiel gefreut, da es auf den Bildern anders aussieht, als die typischen alten C&C-Teile. Die Bilder haben nicht gelogen und es sieht wirklich so aus, jetzt kommt aber der springende Punkt weshalb ich eine RÃ¼ckerstattung meines Geldes (Bundle mit C&C 3) beantragt habe: Es macht Ã¼berhaupt keinen SpaÃŸ!

Ich versuche das etwas nÃ¤her zu erlÃ¤utern. Und zwar gibt es bei dem Spiel nun drei verschiedene MBFs (Offensiv, Defensiv und UnterstÃ¼tzung) die alle unterschiedliche FÃ¤higkeiten, Einheiten und GebÃ¤ude haben.
Die ersten paar Minuten waren sehr verwirrend und ich wusste nicht mal wie ich nun ein GebÃ¤ude platziere. Nach wenigen Minuten habe ich das nun auch herausgefunden, aber der SpielspaÃŸ blieb erheblich auf der Strecke durch das geswitche von offensiven zu defensive zu unterstÃ¼tzendem MBF.

Ich bin echt enttÃ¤uscht von dem Spiel und nicht nur wegen dem Spiel selber, sondern man muss sich bei EA (Origin) anmelden um das Spiel zu spielen.

DAS IST KEIN COMMAND & CONQUER!!
SRY nach 15min konnte ich diesen haufen ScheiÃŸe nicht mehr aushalten..... alleine vom HauptmenÃ¼ und die Musik ne echt nicht...... Habe bis jetzt alle Teile von Anfang an gespielt es waren immer einer der Besten Spiele die es jegab nur DAS NICHT
wie kann man so was entwickeln die hatten wieder nur die $$ im Sinn aber ja EA= EINFACH ABZOCKE -.- und es von Gamestar auch noch 76/100 Punkten bekommen warscheinlich wurden die noch bestochen...ich verstehe es nicht da macht je mein geschÃ¤ft auf dem klo mehr spaÃŸ und sieht besser aus als das Spiel.

PS: Die Entwickler sollten sich da fÃ¼r die Kugel geben wÃ¤re ne wohl Tat!!

WTF have EA done - When Westwood 1st released Command & Conquer & Red Alert they were and still are 2 of my fave games of all time. Since EA bought out Westwood studios and EA'd the games up they have gottern worse with each new game culminating in this tripe.

I do not recomend this to any C&C fan or any RTS fan, the bugs aside (quite a few have gone I know) it's just poorly done, ruining the story the game play is horendous. I couldn't manage more than 6 hours !!!! I've completed all the other C&C games out before this one multiple times C&C 3 I only completed the game with GDI & NOD only once each as it wasn't great, but htis ... this Icouldn't force my self through half of one play through.

column8:
Now... The reason I bought it in the first place? 
I actually played it when it came out, well played a pirated copy lol, and I actually enjoyed it! I played Command and Conquer Red Alert and Command and Conquer 3, both of em, so I understood the "basics" of this series. So I was a bit shocked seeing the gameplay go from base builder to something like Homeworld.

However, I must say that Tiberium Twilight, if we ignore the campaign, isn't so bad! It just feels... unfinished at times in comparison to CnC 3.
What sucks is that I can't get past the in game login screen with the disconnected pop up always preventing me from getting into the game. 

So if  there is a way to have this "disconnecting" issue resolved I would appreciate that! Thank you.

EDIT:
Managed to make it work and, after playing some more, I can definitely say: the gameplay is still as fun as I remember! My issue though is that the games are either too slow or too fast. Sometimes you can't even reach Tier 3 and other times you're fully upgraded, 70/70 supply, and just juggling units until one side reaches the higher number.

To conclude: The game is aight. If you like Homeworld this could make you feel a bit at home with the gameplay, but if you're looking for a base builder akin to old CnC, this ain't it. I'd recommend getting this when it's on sale for around $10 or $15.

A solid 6.9/10. Grind and then forget... and then come back just to screw around lol.

However, I must say that Tiberium Twilight, if we ignore the campaign, isn't so bad! It just feels... unfinished at times in comparison to CnC 3.
What sucks is that I can't get past the in game login screen with the disconnected pop up always preventing me from getting into the game.

Managed to make it work and, after playing some more, I can definitely say: the gameplay is still as fun as I remember! My issue though is that the games are either too slow or too fast. To conclude: The game is aight. If you like Homeworld this could make you feel a bit at home with the gameplay, but if you're looking for a base builder akin to old CnC, this ain't it. I'd recommend getting this when it's on sale for around $10 or $15.

This is a Command & Conquer game undeserving the name. Forget whatever gameplay you are used to from Command & Conquer, it has reduced to building units. No buildings, no tech tree, etc. Campaign cutscenes and story seems to be bad too. Actors do a pretty bad job. In addition you have to register an account and login each time before launching the game. If you do not have an internet connection you can not play and if you have a connection problem while playing the game annoys you with some warning that your progess may not be saved. Ah and I almost forgot: you can only have about 9 units at a time.

Don't buy this! No even for a reduced price of 2 $.

A decent game that killed an entire franchise.

>Campaign consists of seven missions for both GDI and Nod(GDI gets three extra missions for the tutorial levels)
>The story feels rushed
>There's an unnecessary grind to unlock all the units

GDI

>Unlikeable commanding officer. A sad attempt at making a sympathetic character.
>Whole campaign felt pointless(What was I fighting for!!!).
>Pulled the steel talons out of the recycle bin and gave them lazers.
>Shoved anti-armor cannon on top of APC and called it a tank.
>Deprived zone troopers of their Rail guns in order to mass produce them
>Mammoth tank is so afraid of lazers, that it hides behind other units to avoid them.
>Mammoth mk.II sucessor is even more afraid of them than it switched it's occupation from frontline to artillery.

NOD[The good guys?]

>Kane is nice to his tool
>You are said tool
>It is a proven fact that NOD is addicted to infighting
>The ascended love their sweet suits.
>Kane wasn't lying when he said the Tacitus told him of flying ships
>Cyborg Commado gets lazer, becomes legless, channels his inner Chameleon spy and can go full hijacker on a mammoth tank

Scrin[ABSENT]
>Tower is still invincible
>No tiberian Harvest, No invasion force.
>Foreman 371 died on his way back to Ichor Hub

CD keys are tied to Origin/EA accounts. Make an account on origin then use the CD key on that account, then log into this game, then you can play.

Did I mention there's no base building?

column8:
This game is utter crap. Beside the fact that you [b]must[/b] register with EA and that you [b]must[/b] be online each time you want to play, the whole gameplay and atmosphere has been destroyed by the responsible team lead and developers at EA side. I wouldn't recommend this game even for the 2,49 EUR it costs today at the time I'm writing this review... If you want to play RTS and you like C&C, go ahead with Kane's Wrath and you'll maybe much more happy with it.

C&C 4 Tiberian Twilight is a unworthy end of an epic series of games. EA has put a lot of effort to finally destroy this series and to maximize annoyance to fans of the series.

Just remember: You [b]must[/b] register at EA and you [b]must[/b] be online each time you want to play... EA know when you play, how long you play, how you play, your IP address and therefore usually your location, maybe details about your computer and - if you have provided real data - your name and a working email address. It is obvious that you pay with your data for a game that's not worth it... There is no offline mode. 

Even the gameplay is boring and has not too much to do with former C&C parts - it's just the rough story line and the mediocre graphics engine. 

[b]If you want to have a recommendation: Do not buy this game.[/b] It's utter crap. If you want to play C&C, buy Kanes Wrath. It's still not as good as older parts - but it's close enough and ensures some hours of fun.

column8: If you liked all the previous games in this series, then I think you will dislike this final installment. Everything you know about the game has changed... no more base building, no more resource gathering. You need to be fast to win this game. Oh, and you need to log in to play this damn game too. For me, I had to log in twice each time just to play. Pretty pointless. If you like playing with others, then it might be fun. But even still a bit confusing. It starts off slow, and kind of boring, then quickly becomes fast after 3 missions. Fast meaning, you need to move quickly in the battles so you don't lose. About the only things I liked about this game was the return of several units from previous games that were only in certain games. So that was cool. Other than that... not much good to say on my part. I am just one person though. So maybe there are several other reviews that are all positive.

column8: This whole thing is too much like hard work. Before I can play I have to login..!!!? With a password...? Are you kidding me. So I guess that means I need to be online to play. I spent 10 minutes trying to finish an early mission because they had placed a mission directive permanently over the bit of UI I needed to access. What a sad end to such a great legacy.

Command & Conquer is the franchise everyone should recall. After this one I'm sure that anyone does.

I have played through all the previous ones... unfortunately also this one.

Command & Conquer had its unique feeling (something weird is going on, what is this Tiberium?). Red Alert continued with a different way but still it was almost at least intriguing. Maybe more with its own way.

To skip what happened after C&C, C&C Tiberian Sun etc. This game is simply horrific... it looks worse than the Tiberium Wars. The actual gameplay is again... horrific? There is a rockâ€“paperâ€“scissors system that is fucked up totally. The seven meter tall giants only tickle the infantry and the opposite. 

The unit restrictions are ridiculous, you can't do a shit with it. Missions are pretty much fatigue combats that never seem to end. The game also crashed a tons of times in online games. At this point I'm done with the shitty features because the are no good ones.

Summary & Rating

+ 

- Graphically weaker than its predecessor.
- Totally failed rockâ€“paperâ€“scissors system.
- Unit restrictions.
- Crashing online game.

column8:
Well, i did not really enjoy this game.
The systems in this game have strayed so far away from C&C 3: Tiberium Wars that i could not really learn the how-to's of this game.
Honestly, i hope that the next game will be way more like C&C 3: TW!
Still if you want to try out every C&C game or you just wanna see how the multiplayer worked out then try it out!
Still i didn't like it!

-Daniel:  4/10

column8: I never got to play this game. Was not aware of refunds back in the day. Requested for refund recently and was declined because it is past 14 days. I imagine Steam doesn't want to piss off EA by removing this game from the store, even though it is unplayable for years and years for what seems like the vast majority of people. Refunding or exchanging would have been proper. What a waste of my thought and time. A little pissed at steam for being complicit.

I bough this game a long long time ago, around when it was new I think, and being a big fan of C&C I was very excited for it, so I bought the game. I don't remember much from back when I played it, but I remember how dissapointed I was when I played it, I hated it and decided to uninstall the game. But the worst part is yet to come. Recently I decided to reinstall the game, give it a try, maybe see it in a new light now that I'm older, but to my suprise, the game decided to kick me right in the balls, it was asking for a CD key even though I've already activated it a long time ago, so my CD key is already used, so I literally can't play a game I bought even if I wanted to or not which made me really really angry and hate this game even more.

The game itself is bad, lags all time online and story mod makes no sense.
The levelling to unlock new units is badly done grind.
Gameplay itself is boring unit spam. There is no tactics or strategy. 
Simply you have a unit limit and a moving unit spam point, to capture points.

Command&Conquer RIP 
Westood Studios Always in my heart

TL;DR - EA tried to administer unnecessary CPR but used Fart Gas instead of air, and killed the game and series horrifically.

I have been and I still am an avid C&C fan from the very begining. Unfortunately, I can say with absolute certainty that to me this game is as follows: 
"The most horrifyingly, rage coma inducing, 3 week old, mouldy, explosive diarrhea covered, mental and physical 'porrige-made-with-off-milk' projectile vomit inducing, nigh aneurism causing, puss-leaking tumourous growth, in the worlds worst medical waste facility, then mutated and mutilated, into something too nightmarish to even form thoughts and words for, at the sadistic and masochistic hands of EA" 
That I've ever seen and shudder to say 'played' in my entire life to date. (Review written on 2/12/2017, after returning to a C&C binge due to crap games of late)

I feel so sorry for the outstanding actors and actresses, the voice tallents and the graphics devs that put so much work into it, only to be let down by EA's pathetic attempt to "Breathe New Life" into an already outstanding game series, that  DID NOT NEED AN OVERHAUL! It was perfect with C&C 3 and RA3. WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT TO A LEGENDARY SERIES?!

I feel that I speak for most, if not all of the Command & Conquer community when I say: I DEMAND A COMPLETELY REBUILT C&C 4 WITH COMPLETE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN IT'S DEVELOPEMENT!!!

Or at the very least, make the game open to re-developement by the community.

EDIT: I want a refund.

column8:
This game doesn't come close to the previous Command&Conquer games. From the gameplay it is unrecognizable. I played most of the previous titles and this plays like some other franchise. I like playing the singleplayer campaing of most games in one sitting, with this game I wont even finish it after the first couple missions, it's not fun to play.

My main problem with the game is that there are no resources to gather so you pretty much just spam units until you reach the unit limit which is pretty fast and try to kill the enemy in a human wave like attack. For me choosing a Defensive, Offensive, etc starting HQ is redundant in a singleplayer game.

Bought this game many years ago.After install my pc had an anyeurysm and i had to reinstall Windows 7. Havent reinstalled it since. Now i have to resubmit information i dont remember to EA. I dont remember the email linked to this game over 8 years ago let alone the password for it even if i could. So now what? Im just hosed? Good luck getting ANY kind of help from EA. Theyre to busy selling microtransactions to build any kind of decent help page. So, THANK YOU EA for SHIT DRM. See if i buy another EA game.  Shame i cant delete this from my library honestly.


Member when you didnt need an email address for single player?... I member.   Member when you just owned the game you bought?   ... i member.  Yeah i member too.

, you have to have attempted gaming clout and no one will ever trust you to touch another game if they're not too fussed about bankrupty suicide via self immilation and still survived with just enough essence to shit out this cock quest of a borefest.

Look like more simple then old mile stones, only make units from a factory
and send to fight like DOTA in some ways. 
PRO. Good for who like this kind of game, where there are only units fighting and not a sim city.
BAD. Wrost game for who is seeking a game where you make your own citadel like AoE2 or Total Annihilation, Dark Reign, Dune etc... all classical RTS you won't find here

column8:
I couldn't force myself to play this game further as a couple of missions, that's how bad this game is. Don't buy this, it's not worth your wallet and your time!!! Watch the ending sequence on YouTube instead!

- Can't play offline, because EA 
- The game menu looks like sh.it, that's where I first realised how bad it will be.
- Cartoony / bad graphics
- Cartoony units (how should I command my army if they don't even look serious?)
- Horrible combat system (army capacity limits)
- No base building (MCV and couple of turrets, seriously?)
- No refineries / recources (just produce your units for free, generate them out of the oxygen I guess)
- Capture and hold your points on the map to win (Why put it in a C&C game, EA?)
- Missions that don't make sence
- The story is very poorly represented
- In comparison to "Joseph David Kucan" (Kane) all the other characters look just pathetic. Too unprofessional, too young, too ug.ly. 
- The ending sequence is poorly represented.
- The main character (you) dies (Nod) Ending, who gives a sh.it?

I MEAN YOU NEED TO GO OUT ON A BANG FOR THE FINAL GAME NOT REINVENT IT!

column8:
Not a true C&C game. It is an online arena game and they also put an extremely basic C&C story in it, but they did not put any C&C gameplay elements. If you only like playing multiplayer, it's fine. But it's a very simplistic, bad strategy game.
Thankfully, Joe Kucan is Kane once again! If you REALLY want to finish the C&C story, play this game once it gets really cheap.

column8:
Wow.... If you gave me this game along with $10 cash as an apology I would still consider you mean. I love nearly all other of the main flagship C&C games. This one is quite bad. In fact it's the worst RTS game I have played. That's saying a lot. 

Please don't buy this. Don't even download it illegally. Say no kids.


Edit- 
imacatusee most reviews are personal opinion. And you are correct I did not go into any detail with mechanics etc. But I played this game a long time ago. Like 6+ years ago. I was maybe 24 years old at most. I did not play the game long. After I found out how bad it was I stopped playing right away. I then went and read various reviews like I should have before buying the game! I learnt that I was right to stop playing as the game only gets worse not better! So in a nut shell I don't even remember all the issues with the game. Some float around in the back of my head but it's just that bad.... If I went to brainstorm a proper review I would end up hating myself for putting more effort into the review then the developers put into the product. 

So my review still stands as a warning! Basically people can see my review. Go oh... he did not like this game. Maybe I should read more reviews or check out a lets play or video etc... But this game is god awful. Like a 0 out of 10. Okay fine it's more like a 2 out of 10.  Noo.... Actually it may be like a 0 out of 10. If you can't PAY me to play it then we have issues.

column8:
I am a huge fan of the Command & Conquer series. CnC Generals is still regarded as one of my favorite games of all time. This game, however, is nothing like the other CnC games. At least while I played it. There was no base building, just pick your MRV or whatever and pop out units like a chicken on crack. Then, if you start losing and it dies, no worries, another will respawn down for you. 

Command & Conquer was always a base building, army building, thrash your enemies kind of game in each iteration that I've played. This is not like that at all.  It would have been better to just call it something else. On top of that, you have the always online, which made it so I couldn't even play it on my laptop till I hit WiFi spots while traveling. If I hadn't already went over the refund hours on it, I would have refunded it long ago.
column9:

The game is great. Yea sure there are limits to unit caps and such. Sure theres a limit to everything you do. So what? It makes the game more interesting! Leveling up to use better units/upgrades/powers is an awesome feature. Why have everything given to you at the start? You should earn your ranks before you can operate more powerful units and upgrades. Think of CoD MW Series Multiplayer, you level up in ranks to earn better gear, this is basicly the same thing but for units and upgrades. If you don't play, you wont earn anything. I say give this a chance, complete story mode, and atleast play a few AI/Player matches before you decide to rate this game anyworse than people have already made it. I give the game 10/10 its awesome, great graphics, movie-like cutscreens, leveling system, capture points OR deathmatch gamemodes, etc. I would recommend this game to my friends, just so we can play together. Have fun on the game, thx for reading!

The worst one of the series, I know sometimes it's good to be out of our confort area, but here...
If you had played the others games (I mean C&C, RA or Generals), it was like a B movie, enjoyable, fun. 
This one have nothing, it's bland.

Anyway, the graphics are ok but the cam is so near, I wish I could zoom out. 
The music is not memorable (who forget the Hell March or Mechanical Man of the other for example).

I hope Kane will rise again one day but for now he must take a long rest.

column8:
So Id like to go on a extreamly long rant on how they ruined this great series but ill just give you the simple facts. There are three major reasons why this game is an awful buy, I believe it was a waste of money due to how horrible the three things are.
1) the RTS from the original games allowed for full unit usage. What I mean is you where not limited to what you could play with depending on the structure you choose durring a deploy phase. Yep you are limited in your units as to which of three main stuctures you choose. While this was a great idea you can only deploy one crawler at a time where enmies in the main story can deploy more. This makes the game play fustratingly difficult.
2) The severly limited pop cap, Ok population caps are important but in the game the pop cap is 50.... units beyond basic crap units are 6 or higher. This is awlful considering how limited and how long it takes to produce said units. In pvp this can be a fustrating experance. In story mode it is even more so due to the fact each crawler of an opponate has its own cap of 50.
3) You do not build.... Ok bar the previous two issues this is my main problem with this game command and conquer is a paced building war machine... this means you start a map with little and you slowly conquer it with a play style that suits your personal abilities. In this game pushing with a large force not happening you cant build multiple development buldings. Want to tower it up? fuck no if your not in the defence crawler, oh and btw these towers blow ass. No i mean seriously they take shit loads of damage from units and do little to no damage to units that they dont directly counter.
Please if you plan to buy this... crap that came out of some programers ass reconsider you will most likely end up regreting the purchuse as i have.

I was hoping for a grand finally that introduced a new style of RTS
The story wasn't anything special and just came across as weird at some points.
You need to grind a lot to unlock the higher teir units.
Maybe I am just bad at the game but every battle ended with me hoping my crawler could build units faster than their crawler.
And of coures you need to be always connected to play single player and I felt like I lost connection every 10 minutes.

column8:
Wow! Here we go; this crappy game review. You know, I went into this game knowing it was terrible beyond belief, but nothing would've predicted this monstrosity! Well, matter as well start off with the positives if there were any:

Pros:
-Kane
-New Tactics
-Kane
-Forgiving game with mistakes
-Uninstallation button
-Did I mention Kane?

Truth be told, there isn't a lot of good things about this game! I played it for as long as I could before I just told myself no! I can't play this anymore! My goal was to play it to see what happened at the end of the game, and for $5, it seems reasonable to waste your money on something so cheap. However, even going into this game KNOWING it's trash, I still couldn't finish it! It was that bad! If you're curious about the ending, just look up the campaign cutscenes through YouTube or something. Do yourself a favor and keep that $5. 

But for the few positive things I did say about it, it is true that Kane (Joseph Kucan) is the only set in stone thing that's worth the buy here. The man's entire life is based on this gaming franchise, and every CaC fan should pay respect to this man's future in this game considering it went downhill for CaC after this game's release. The game also offers new tactics with the Crawler unit that you have to protect now. 

So instead of base building (you know, the thing that made the Command and Conquer gaming franchise famous), you now have this Crawler, and the missions are now turned to escort missions rather than destroying your enemy base! But nevertheless, if you lose a Crawler in battle, do not fret! You get to respawn a new Crawler in a designated area that the AI doesn't know about and you don't have to start over the mission! Yay! All the Crawler does is turn itself into a construction yard and build units to defend it, that's all! No buildings, no Tiberium, no fun! All the player could do with the Crawler is choose between 3 classes, Offence, Defense, and Support. And even though the tutorial gives you all the classes special abilities and whatnot, you have to earn experience points to unlock the simplest abilities! So you're forced to go back and play the same damn missions again and again! 

Ugh! If you look up the interview the developers had once the CaC4 was released, they talked about how RTS games are getting tedious, and how they thought this new change would help it. The problem there is that you don't simply change the entire gameplay that the franchise was founded on. Other games like the Red Alert trilogy, CaC3, CaC General Zero Hour, CaC Tiberium Sun and many others continued to show off the wonderful RTS experience that CaC4 completely killed! You can't do that under the CaC name, you just can't. EA forever killed this franchise, so have fun with their last game if you're still very interested in it. But for the market value of $20, don't even think of purchasing it! It's not worth it! 

If you want to know the negatives, here you go:
Cons:
-Tedious gameplay
-Boring campaign
-Multiplayer servers are down
-Useless units
-No Tiberium collection
-Always have to sign into EA when you start up the game
-No base building
-Last CaC game ever
-Crawler unit
-Cap amount on units made
-Experience system for the simplest abilities
-Acting was mediocre
-Killed CaC franchise
-Too expensive at retail price
-No other known actors
-No cool looking costumes
-Graphics are meh
-Having to review such a good franchise dead
-No one likes the game
-No one will play with you
-Screw you developers, you suck
-Don't
-Buy
-This
-Game
-It
-Sucks
-Balls
-And
-Ass!

I have a mixed feeling, mostly game has +, like Joseph Kucan, who is in my opinion Iconic face of Tiberian series. New mechanic makes you to use more tactic, more thinking, but some old units have been changed, or reworked (Avatar, Buggy, etc.). Gameplay is more forgiving when you lose units, since you dont need tiberium to spawn them, but game can sometimes be cruel if you make solid mistake, costing even in Crawler. It's only one C&C I played when I had to save often.

The final entry in a series that had gone downhill over half a decade. This title will ever be remembered as the entry in the series that completely killed the series.

A total revamp of the CnC formula, seemingly in an attempt to "modernize" the series. However despite massive backlash and concerns pre-release EA went ahead and released the game anyway. And the rest is history.

Crappy Graphics, non standard RTS gameplay. It's not C&C, but an JRPG in an RTS wrapper.

No bases, Mandated choose a class and use those units. 
In order to complete a mission youve gotta capture the points and hold them all. 

That and a Mandated Constant Internet connection. Not good for those who have limited data plans.

column8:
This game isn't even an RTS, it's a squad moba where your "heroes" shit out creeps that you can control. They tried to copy dawn of war 2 but failed in an epic way. This isn't new for Electronic Arts, it seems the format for this company is to pump out a hot piece of crap within 3 months then charge people 80 dollars for it.

This game single handedly killed the franchise, which was weakening after Red Alert 3. EA got almost everything right with Tiberian sun and Generals, but who ever took over the leadership after that is obviously a junky or a retard of some sort.

Pros:
-It's cheap
-multiplayer still works
-story

Cons:
-No base building
-Still using the extremely dated generals engine
-Not balanced at all
-Population is extremely small
-Killed the franchise

It would be different if EA revisted the series and corrected all their mistakes, but instead they doubled down and made a free to play browser game that does not resemble the series at all, which was called Tiberian/Tiberium Alliances.

If you are reading this, don't bother buying this hunk of shit. Visit cnc online and just download the older games, patch them with the cnc online patch and you will be able to play multiplayer again. And for the love of god stop giving EA money.

If you are reading this, don't bother buying this hunk of shit. Visit cnc online and just download the older games, patch them with the cnc online patch and you will be able to play multiplayer again. And for the love of god stop giving EA money.

I'm very glad that I bought the C&C Bundle because of Red Alert 3 and Tiberium Wars but most definately not because of Tiberian Twilight. I'm astonished EA published this. I have no idea what is going on with this game. The menus are barely there. There are few options when you start a (pseudo-)"skirmish" and with most of those I can't imagine what they do most of the time. The crucial option in a FACTION-based RTS is being able to change said faction but I couldn't figure out how to do that. On top of that it's predecessors look amazing...this does not.

Not to mention the gameplay. To be fair I did not look into the campaign (and I probably won't in the near future) but when I go into a skirmish in an RTS and I can't figure out what's going on in front of me then I don't want to play that game anymore. C&C is not about spawning some random units and then pillow-fighting over some random control-node but thats how it feels here.

In conclusion: Save yourself the time and money and don't buy this. I would't have bought it myself but I was gonna buy C&C 3 and Red Alert 3 (on sale at the moment I bought the bundle) anyway and in the "Command & Conquer Pack" bundle basically got Tiberian Twilight "for free".

Foreward: Time listed played for this title does not reflect full play-time w/ game, have completed both campaigns.

Its painful to even be on this storepage writing this review. I can honestly feel a tiny twinge of a headache coming on so i'll get to my points.

Command & Conquer, as a series, is one of the grandfathers of all modern base-building RTS games up there with Warcraft as well. While the series saw a few minor adjustments to the lore here 'n there it was always a very solid setting whose factions i'll cover briefly:

The Brotherhood of Nod is/was a paramilitary organization with ties to just about every major country that isn't afflicted w/ Tiberium or the first world "Blue zones". It's ranks are comprised not JUST of hundreds of millions of loyal militia but also extremely well-trained and well organized black ops infiltrators and die-hard fantical soldiers. Lead by "Kane", while it was never openly announced, it was highly alluded to that he was in fact the mythical brother of Abel from the bible, thus meaning he has existed since almost the literal dawn of time. While Kane was always viewed as EXTREMELY charismatic, he was also astoundingly cunning and a survivor above all, surviving not one but 2 seperate attacks from WMD-scale orbital weapons platforms despite being at the ground-zero of both attacks.

In C&C 4 this appears to have all been retconned and it now alludes that Kane is an alien seeking to go home.

The Global Defense Initiative (or GDI) is effectively the UN/NATO and every other western first-world 3 or 4 letter organization all smashed into one giant organization. GDI are essentially "The good guys", the Free world all gathered together to try and stomp out The Brotherhood of Nod and stop Tiberium from spreading across the globe, the highly toxic green crystal has turned much of the planet into an uninhabitable hellscape labled "Red Zones" and semi-infested zones (Yellow zones) both of which Nod operates out of predominantly.

Now, as mentioned previously, base-building was extremely important in previous games because your resources were rarely directly inside your base and could deplete rapidly, creating a NEED to control the map's terrain to move to new fields while the expended ones slooooowly regenerated. There was also the matter that air units had to return to the structure that created them to resupply, even the very use of your minimap was a feature given by one of your buildings.

Here, thats no longer the case, base building has been entirely removed and replaced with different 'styles' of command structure, restricting access to what units you can produce. It takes away a huge aspect of the game for the sake of trying to make the game more 'user friendly' but instead only takes away from the experience.

On top of this, C&C 4 was the ending to the story of Kane as far as we were told, it is the conclusion......and it's endings answers precisely zero plot questions despite more and more cropping up as the series progressed. Theres also the matter that the game tries to shoe-horn in a Co-Op experience, something none of the previous games did and while good on paper, it fails to make up for the rest of the game's failures.

In short, C&C 4 neutered a major part of what made the earlier games unique, failed to deliver any note-worthy answers to questions that'd existed since the series began over a decade ago and left most (if not all) of it's fans (as is probably apparent by the reviews) with a very very sour taste in our mouths.

column8:
The final stunning conclusion to the Tiberium Wars series this game could have been... but ultimately it wasn't. It is still fun to play provided you ignore the previous 15+ years of lore. I liked the game inspite of wanting to hate it.

The biggest issue is EA's attempt to "introduce a multitude of innovations to the classic fast and fluid Command & Conquer gameplay". BIG MISTAKE! A bit of fine tuning or maybe a single change would have been fine and accepted by the masses but attempting to turn the entire RTS genre on it's head from it's root origins way back in Dune 2: Battle for Arrakis/Building a Dynasty (yep I owned both and argued with friends about the title) was a bad idea that wasn't play tested enough and then when executed signaled the death bell of this otherwise Glorious Franchaise.

Audio/Sound: 10/10. The sound engineering and audio in the game is freaking brilliant. The music is absoluting amazing and soulful with each battle/mission. The menu music almost makes you feel like you're in some form of command centre and the troops are awaiting your orders to throw themselves into the fray. It's very thematic and is done well, even the FMV have an excellent tone to them.

Video: 8/10. The visuals are fantastic. The FMV have always been top notch (ignoring Tiberium Dawn's blue-screen era) and they don't disappoint. But while in game I can't help but feel the visuals got a severe downgrade from the E3 trailers and previews. Not sure if it was a QA or coding issue that changed this but it was a bit of a disappointment. But still the game looks great compred to some of the RTS clones out there.

Gameplay: 4/10. Sadly this is where it all goes to hell. It is C&C. But it's not the RTS we want. Or the one we deserve. Mobile fluid command structures aren't anything new. Dark Reign, Supreme Commander and a few others have done this before and always to a varying degree of failure when it comes to reception of the players. Why they decided to follow this course is a mystery... maybe they did want the franchaise to end and die? Why? No idea.

To non-C&C fans of RTS games I must suggest that you avoid this. To the C&C fans whom want to see an ending... well I'm a hardcore fan and played them all back to back(even Renegade) before getting to this game and for me it was worth it to get an ending. If you're not that keen but want to see an ending then I suggest youtube'ing the FMV cinematics but you probably won't get the same impact.

I will say this having an end boss fight was unexpected and a nice twist and the GDI bring the pain with their ultimate super-heavy vehicle (no spoilers I promise) but holy heck it kicks butt and took me 26 minutes to bring down... yep it's that tough but then again I like to play on stupidly hard cause I'm a sucker for pain... hrm maybe that's why I liked the game.

Game on!

Got this for less than $5 in a sale and in a bundle.. effectively making it pretty much free after the bundling. I still regret it.
The deep discount doesn't change my disgust with the route EA took the franchise. This is like an entirely different game. 
This is NOT Command & Conquer. I'm not sure what it is trying to be.. but they missed the mark so hard it's a different genre. When you need several levels of tutorials to explain just how different it is.. you F*%@ED UP! 
C&C should be intuitive enough to rts players without that need. Sorely disappointed. Deleted.

column8:
I've played every Command & Conquer game since 1995. Every release kept me going on for hours. As most others probably were, was glad beyond believe that the fourth and final installment in the long lasting Tiberium series was coming, but when I finally got the game... well simply enough this isn't Command & Conquer, It's a horrid waste of money and time with practically nothing in common with past installments and answers almost none of the questions we were told it would answer and as such this "Epic conclusion of the Tiberium saga" as EA calls it, doesn't deserve to be honored with the title of Command & Conquer 4. 

In short Command & Conquer 4 is atrocious, end of story. Despite the inclusion of several new features, Command & Conquer 4 is an unenjoyable and easily forgettable experience.

C&C was a masterpiece, it could've been copy pasted with new graphics and bigger maps and they could've taken more of my money. As it stands, I won't be buying anything from this title again, and I will certainly not be recommending it to anyone i know.

You went to far from the origional to be successful, now you ave a title that has no definable game structure, well done.

column8: Game installation is very troublesome.

I "played" via ""Origin"" mostly so my time shown here doesn't represent the time I've put into the game but.. 
Heres a video version of this.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MuWXHvvoOiA

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/RebusForeverReviews#curation

A Mini 'Rebview'!!

Do you like real-time strategy games?
Did you while away hours, just playing skirmish maps  throughout the C&C franchise ?
Did you marvel at the hammy acting and silly stories in the campaign and test friendships in vs battles?
Did you enjoy managing your base and slowly wresting control of the map from your opponents, all the while protecting your harvesters and amassing your forces for that planned overwhelming assault? 
Is Command and Conquer 4 the game for you?
Nope, probably not. 

Thanks for reading, check my other reviews.

What!!?

What do you mean that's not good enough? 

Okay then, second time's a charm....
Do you hate previous Command and Conquer games and wish they never existed? 
Did you play level 7 of Dune 2 as a child and decide if you can't have a base nobody should?
Do you think innovation within a franchise should automatically mean a complete and utter deviation from that franchise's core mechanics? 
Do you get a sense of inner fulfillment when EA takes over other studios and then homogenizes and dumbs their properties down?
Then this might be the game for you..... 
You monster. 

Firstly, sorry to the live action actors, they acted their little hearts out.
And now the dirty work.... 
The game itself 'features' a perspective limited to about 3ft off the ground.
Replacing bases and harvesters is a crawler mechanic done better elsewhere.
The crawler acts as a mobile HQ that can deploy sort of acting like a base, but not.
Limited unit selection is improved slightly as each of the 3 crawlers for the two factions has a selection of unique abilities and units - providing a thin faÃ§ade of choice - so long as your choice doesn't involve wanting to play a Command and Conquer game!

The game does look good for its age and still had a bunch of people playing it online, but based on my time with the game I'm forced to assume they get some sort of masochistic thrill from sticking with it, but far be it from me to kink shame.

The units may look acceptable but the tiny unit cap in the missions I played was not, the game may have merits when considered as its own thing, but as a long time fan of the franchise and Westwood's work it pains me to see the Command and Conquer title connected to this game.

C&C 4 is a compelling Asylum B movie, tethered to a game forged by an exact and precise series of awful decision; like an entire solar system whose planets orbit comes into alignment once every billion years and unleashes some dark force, Command and Conquer 4 came into being- spawned from a heady mix of EA's contempt for the franchise and a desire for accessibility that seemingly took precedence at every stage of designing the games mechanics.  

If you are new to the franchise or enjoyed Homeworld Deserts of Karak it might be worth playing but as a Command and Conquer fan I'd be honoured to recomend that nobody play this game, ever, not even for nostalgia.... 

Thanks for the read and if you enjoyed this feedback is always appreciated.
If you checked out the video review lemme know you came from Steam.

The worst disgrace EA has ever published. Take a 20 year old strategy series with countless great games, grind it to dust, remove key elements of the entire genre, make it pseudo-coop-multiplayer-online-only and watch it all burn to the ground.

Worst company decision of EA, ever. I wish Westwood wouldn't have gone bankrupt and they would have made C&C Generals 2.

Stay away from this. Even as a gift, you should remove this from your library. You should never pay a single cent for it. Never.

column8:
It's taken me a while (Like 2 years I think) but I'd finally like to come around to say that this game is garbage. Having been a huge fan of the series since childhood, to see it become something so simplistic and yet so convoluted is painful. I've played better RTS on my tablet. This game is a steaming pile of garbage, and barely lives up to even being called an RTS. On top of that, running it is a pain. Constant FPS drops making it unplayable, and it's just generally not a good time.

0/10, would rather play C&C64

It made me cry. I first got a hold of Command and Conquer with Red Alert Retaliation on the PSX when my dad came home from Bosnia. When I asked him if I could play it, he said it would just make me mad. I was maybe 6. I didn't know what to do. I learned how to select and grab units by holding down the X button and moving the directional buttons. I selected all my units and would move them about. I didn't know that big ass fucking truck could turn into a structure that built more structures. Boy, was I fucking excited then! I used to leave my playstation on in the morning and come back after school to continue with my skirmishes. I'd like to play "Peacekeeper" where I'd prevent the cpu's from killing each other off. Then I got the Firestorm pack. Fast Forward to about maybe 9 years later and I had a pc in my room. One of those prebuilt ones your mom and dad give you when they get a new one. 

I bought the Pack that contained Red Alert 2. Red Alert 2 Yuris Revenge. Renegade. Tiberian Sun. and Firestorm. It was with Renegade that I got on the internet and found out about Gamespy. Fuck I miss the ol days. It was great. I was ignorant and didn't know about the greed of companies yet. Then eventually CnC3 came out. I was HYPED! I thought I was for GDI. But then Kane's Wrath came out. Now Im a Noddie fer lyfe! 

Then.... Then IT came out. The abomination called CNC4. I bought it of course. I kept telling myself that it had to have base building in it. Why would they do that?! Why would they turn it into a cash grab?! Don't they care about us? I never played the campaign. I didn't want to. 

Until today. March 24th 2017. I will face the campaign and deal with it. Because I know EA will never part with the IP. They suck companies dry and then throw them in the pit of the dead and move on to the next ones. 

RIP Westwood and my childhood innocence. 

Goodluck to Petroglyph.

And may EA and every Executive there burn in hell.

At 4:44 AM on March 25th. I finished the NoD campaign. I feel sick to my stomach.

column8:
A kick in the teeth to the Command and Conquer: Tiberium Wars series. If there was an actual story at all, it was more bland than a box of uncooked rice. The pvp system is absolute crap, and you will find yourself needing to be carried to even begin to be able to fight with one specific class of army at a time. Because to hell with unit diversity.

This was a bastardization of the RTS genre, and frankly I want to set my copy on fire, but since it's digital, I guess a giant thumbs down works.

As a big fan of the C&C series I had big hopes for this game based on the previous episodes. It's a complete disappointment, it's absolutely different than the previous games, they took everything from it that made it C&C, no base building, no money, lack of story and proper game modes... The only thing I can mention as positive is the graphics.

If you are thinking about buying it, let me give you an advice: Do NOT buy it!

column8:
(SUMMARY OF THIS REVIEW: DON'T BUY THIS GAME. EA KILLED CNC WITH THIS GAME)

With this game, Command and Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight, electronic arts put forth their single greatest INSULT to the gaming community, and ultimately one of the dumbest business decisions in gaming history. In a pathetic, short sighted attempt at trying to push the highly coveted Command And Conquer brand onto a new generation of gamer, they have destroyed everything CNC has stood for.

In order to appeal to a NEW playerbase of (GUESSTIMATE) 50 000-80 000 players from a NEW generation of gamers, they have created a fast paced RTS that is so heavily disconnected from the ENTIRE CNC genre up to this point, it is unrecognizeable as an actual command and conquer title, and more closely resembles a next-gen mobile-tower defense game.

In doing so, EA Games made its BIGGEST mistake. In order to appeal to a NEW small audience, they ALIENATED the older audience which comprises over two MILLION players, probably more. From both a lore standpoint and shockingly a business standpoint, CNC4 was a BIG mistake.

While CNC 4 is in itself a good game for what it is, not a true RTS but more an RTS based mobile tower defense game. Good graphics, good gameplay, good story, brilliant unit balancing, as always to be expected from a CNC title. But, the game is NOT command and conquer. The original CNC games were base building, calling on MASSIVE armies of PC shattering numbers of units into HUGE, tiny or small battlefields.

THAT is what the players of the CNC series grew up with. Thats what they fell in love with. THAT gameplay mechanic of building a fortress and a massve army was what drove CNC fans down its very long history to make it one of if not THE greatest RTS-defining franchises in gaming history.

Command and Conquer universe - with the exception of CNC Renegade (an FPS based in the tiberium universe) - has been defined by base building, resource management, resource collection, base defense, tactical decisions and heavy strategy that have molded playstyles that have blown away other RTS games, and even set the precedent on what to beat for the entire RTS gaming industry.

Command and Conquer Generals and its extension Zero Hour, STILL have a loyal fan base, online community and very extensive modding community that, years on, is still loyally playing a game they've had for ages, completely ignoring anything NEW you try to produce. Most true CNC fans will buy CNC4 because its command and conquer, but will NEVER play it after the first few times logging in.

But, for now i shall leave you with the following review of CNC4 Tib Twilight:

For what it is, it's a good, fun game.

Good Graphics.
Good gameplay.
Good story.
Good skirmish modes.
Challenging AI.

But these do not excuse it. It is NOT command and conquer, and for this reason

I DO NOT CONSIDER THIS GAME, CNC4 TIBERIAN TWILIGHT, TO BE CANON TO THE CNC FRANCHISE.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

While CNC 4 is in itself a good game for what it is, not a true RTS but more an RTS based mobile tower defense game. Good graphics, good gameplay, good story, brilliant unit balancing, as always to be expected from a CNC title. But, the game is NOT command and conquer. The original CNC games were base building, calling on MASSIVE armies of PC shattering numbers of units into HUGE, tiny or small battlefields.

THAT is what the players of the CNC series grew up with. Thats what they fell in love with. THAT gameplay mechanic of building a fortress and a massve army was what drove CNC fans down its very long history to make it one of if not THE greatest RTS-defining franchises in gaming history.

Command and Conquer universe - with the exception of CNC Renegade (an FPS based in the tiberium universe) - has been defined by base building, resource management, resource collection, base defense, tactical decisions and heavy strategy that have molded playstyles that have blown away other RTS games, and even set the precedent on what to beat for the entire RTS gaming industry.

Command and Conquer Generals and its extension Zero Hour, STILL have a loyal fan base, online community and very extensive modding community that, years on, is still loyally playing a game they've had for ages, completely ignoring anything NEW you try to produce. Most true CNC fans will buy CNC4 because its command and conquer, but will NEVER play it after the first few times logging in.

But, for now i shall leave you with the following review of CNC4 Tib Twilight:

For what it is, it's a good, fun game.

Good Graphics.
Good gameplay.
Good story.
Good skirmish modes.
Challenging AI.

But these do not excuse it. It is NOT command and conquer, and for this reason

I DO NOT CONSIDER THIS GAME, CNC4 TIBERIAN TWILIGHT, TO BE CANON TO THE CNC FRANCHISE.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

Ever since this game has launched, back when even win7 used to be non existant, 64 bit users have been crying about crash issues with this game, well, here i am on win 10 64 bit 7 years after the game was launched and the old issues still refuse to be fixed. In my case the game launched fine with 800/600 or something resolution, the lowest possible on a i7 4790k cpu with gtx 980 and 16 gb ram, it crashed as soon as i changed the resolution to 2560/1440.
A big thumbs down to a game i was so eagerly looking forward to play, coming from a guy who played all cc games

column8:
Greetings!  Iâ€™m going to say something that doesnâ€™t seem the norm based off the reviews of this game.  I liked this game.  Iâ€™ve always been a fan of Command & Conquer and although this game definitely isnâ€™t my favorite it does seem to hold up pretty well.

Graphics:  No, these graphics arenâ€™t amazing but they do hold up from when the game first came out.  I canâ€™t really complain as they were pretty amazing when the game first came out, they hold up pretty well.  Battle damage is still present and the particle effects are still pretty good. Iâ€™d love to see more RTS do battle damage and such.

Mechanics:  I have to compare this to a modern product and with that said the mechanics do hold up tolerably but I keep going back to the gold standard of controls for RTS:  StarCraft 2.  I wish RTS would just look at the standard SC2 has set and make that their minimum.  Yes, you need innovation but you should start at least with the core.  I did find the unit selection double press feature very useful (on press you select all combat units, double and you select all units).  If I was rating this completely on mechanics Iâ€™d probably be more in the not recommend as the controls have not kept up in the world of precision, to many times I couldnâ€™t move a unit too close to something or his pathing would lead him somewhere completely opposite of where I wanted him to go.  Andâ€¦one game type for skirmish?  Really? Sigh.

RPG:  I wish more games would include some of the leveling features that this game has, Iâ€™d love to see a mode where you level up and unlock new units, or include veterancy.  Yes, I know these arenâ€™t very â€˜competitiveâ€™ features, so maybe make them toggled or their own game type.  In fact, the core design of this game (the mobile base building and focus on less units and more action) would be an amazing game type for RTS but kind of falls flat as the core component.  Ultimately, I would have loved to see this game take off more so if nothing else these game types would have continued on.

Story:  Unfortunately, this story felt the most forgettable over all the other C&C games.  I know I beat this when it first came out but for the life of me didnâ€™t remember any of the story, I actually remember the story of most of the C&C world but this one slipped me.  Iâ€™m not sure if they werenâ€™t trying but it actually felt more like a game copying the C&C world than a C&C game.

Ultimately, I am cycling between a positive or negative review.  I look at everything and see more negative thoughts than positive, but this game is 6 years old and I just replayed the campaign and overall enjoyed itâ€¦ but I love C&C.  Should you buy this?  Eh, if you like C&C yes, if you are just looking for a good RTS Iâ€™d look elsewhere or go back in time 6 years and play it when it comes out.

column8:
If you are looking for a large scale RTS, this game is NOT for you.

If you want to control air, land, AND sea, this game is not for you.

If you want limited variety in troop type and faction, this game IS for you.


In other words, as an RTS, this game is horrible.  As a grand strategy involving massive amounts of units and big-picture tactics, this game as failed.  

I would only reccomend this game if you prefer to manage a small number (no more than 20 or 30) of each type of unit.
