This version of CnC got quite a lot of flack from various thing. Listing some:
1.) This version of CnC greatly move in a different gameplay of RTS compare to other CnC. SO DIFFERENT. I pretty much understand those who say that the classic CnC gameplay is much  better since it was the one that they got to play since their childhood (Nostalgia factor is a plus). This version greatly rewarded those who knows a little bit of micro-managing (Especially those who are good in that matter). New gameplay, new strategies, new tactics.

2.) EA launch this game in Steam via 3rd party software, which you have to make an account with EA to play it. I got no problem doing that as I have a lot of games doing that in my Steam library, however the create new account link in launch program is broken, so you have to go directly to the site (minor inconvinience). Other thing, creating new account is pretty much a pain in the neck depending on your location, so I have to activate my VPN (Germany) to successfully make a new account. This could make those who are kinda not informed what VPN is lose interest in playing this game.

3.) You can not play this without internet connection, as you have to login everytime you launch this game. Big minus point.

I played this game until I finished GDI and NOD Brotherhood path. I quite say that I got the game mechanic and game play after few games (due to the fact that compare to other CnC, this version is like entirely another game). If you'll give it some time, it's enjoying. Hard and rewarding. Although the campaign was so short that if you have no other friend to play with, this gonna go lame very fast.

Oh, and a lot of people are rampantly cheating coz of weak-ass anti-cheat system of EA.

I recommend only getting this in bundle with the rest of CnC in Steam. Buying it alone is truly not worth the money.

DONT BOTHER!!!!

I cannot play this game. EA requires you to create an account with them to even run the game app. However, when you click on the Create Account button on the log in screen, you are taken to a 404 error, a webpage that no longer exists.

So I tried troubleshooting that for about 14 hours because I can be kind of a techie and try to solve my own problems. During that time, I kept closing and reopening the app or leaving that login screen up while I went to research the issue, attempt get tech support, poop, what have you. Now that the play time exceeds 2 hours as far as steam is concerned, STEAM WILL NOT GIVE ME A REFUND.

So I guess I paid 20 bucks to be able to see the game listed in my library. Huzzah. I really should have read the comments before buying.
column9:
DONT BOTHER!!!!

I cannot play this game. EA requires you to create an account with them to even run the game app. However, when you click on the Create Account button on the log in screen, you are taken to a 404 error, a webpage that no longer exists.

So I tried troubleshooting that for about 14 hours because I can be kind of a techie and try to solve my own problems. During that time, I kept closing and reopening the app or leaving that login screen up while I went to research the issue, attempt get tech support, poop, what have you. Now that the play time exceeds 2 hours as far as steam is concerned, STEAM WILL NOT GIVE ME A REFUND.

So I guess I paid 20 bucks to be able to see the game listed in my library. Huzzah. I really should have read the comments before buying.

column8: Absolutely, under no circumstances, should you buy this game. Its a shit quasi-MOBA that tried to steal too much at once. The other C&C games are a completely diffent genre than this abomination. If you're looking for this kind of playstyle, go log onto Heroes of the Storm and play as Abathur. Its literally the same thing, only with better servers and support. I had high hopes for a command and conquer sequel, but EA decided to take the hopes and dreams of its fanbase, coat it in human feces and set it on fire. On a scale of one to ten, this game is gof*ckyourself/10.

Basically EA does what it does best and ruins the game franchise "to open it to new players"

the simplified everything

infantry are singular units you can only get with defense mcv's
ground vehicles are offense mcv's
air is support mcv's

the amount of units that exist has been cut down to a huge extent, theres an at guy, anti infantry guy and anti air guy which pretty much sms up the rest of em

no heavy or light no special units oh no

to be quite blun this thing is a cartoonish caracature of what command and conquer should be.

The only good thing about this game is Kane but the writing for him is obviously lazy and you can tell, its really unfortunate.

Do not buy this game, i only got it as  a bundle in a sale

Fuck you EA, just fuck you

Niveau graphisme ce jeu est limite, niveau gameplay c'est du cap & win en spammant les unitÃ©s comme un abruti, pas de constructions possibles de batiments, progression de niveau global qui permet de crÃ©er seulement 1/3 des unitÃ©s au dÃ©but du jeu, se dÃ©bloque par faction (donc nÃ©cessite la mÃªme stupide jauge Ã  remplir pour les deux factions), seulement 2 factions jouables, le mode en ligne est impossible sans avoir tout dÃ©bloquÃ© car les autres joueurs vous feront les fesses...

Ce jeu est Ã  Ã©viter, je l'ai achetÃ© dans le bundle en promo de C&C et trÃ¨s honnÃªtement je regrette sincÃ¨rement de l'avoir eu dedans, j'aurais prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© ne pas l'obtenir et passer Ã  cotÃ© de cet Ã©tron tellement la dÃ©sillusion est grande...

MÃªme en promotion ce jeu ne mÃ©rite pas d'Ãªtre achetÃ©, l'intÃ©rÃªt d'un tel jeu est strictement rÃ©servÃ© aux personnes qui aiment ce genre de jeux, certainement pas Ã  ceux qui aiment C&C... Il s'agit bien la d'un jeu totalement diffÃ©rent, je le rappelle...

column8: Mandatory EA account required. Locked out of most units until you have played the game enough to acquire arbitrary XP amount set by developers (even in skirmish mode). Inferior visual quality, animations, and gameplay when compared to C&C 3 (which is an earlier game by several years). Kane is no longer the Messiah. Tiberium saga ends with a wimper instead of a bang. Would not recommend.
column9: Mandatory EA account required. Locked out of most units until you have played the game enough to acquire arbitrary XP amount set by developers (even in skirmish mode). Inferior visual quality, animations, and gameplay when compared to C&C 3 (which is an earlier game by several years). Kane is no longer the Messiah. Tiberium saga ends with a wimper instead of a bang. Would not recommend.

column8: A once proud RTS series, reduced to a pathetic game of rock-paper scissors, with no tactics other then what counters what, and no resource management or base building. The only thing Tiberian Twilight has in common with the earlier entries in the series, even with the third game, is the presence of Joe Kucan as Kane- and the dead, empty look in his eyes tells you what you need to know. Avoid this game at all costs.

I really wanted to like this game.  

I enjoyed the other games in the C&C Tiberium universe, and the setting feels like a good continuation of that... but I just cannot get past the gameplay.  Screenshots and videos might be staged to make this look like it plays like other C&C games, but it really does not.  There is a big focus on small unit tactics, limited armies, micro-management, and territory control.  In truth, this would not make a bad PvP skirmish game, with short session times and persistant leveling to build an army.  Sadly, this model does not fit well with a single player campaign game, particularly if one expects a more traditional C&C experience.  

I might recommend this if you just wanted a skirmish game, but odds are anyone who wants that experience will go looking for something more dedicated to that purpose.  Anyone who comes to this looking for a traditional C&C game will come away disappointed.  I cannot recommend this title without major, major caveats.
column9:

Screenshots and videos might be staged to make this look like it plays like other C&C games, but it really does not.  There is a big focus on small unit tactics, limited armies, micro-management, and territory control.  In truth, this would not make a bad PvP skirmish game, with short session times and persistant leveling to build an army.  Sadly, this model does not fit well with a single player campaign game, particularly if one expects a more traditional C&C experience.  

I might recommend this if you just wanted a skirmish game, but odds are anyone who wants that experience will go looking for something more dedicated to that purpose.  Anyone who comes to this looking for a traditional C&C game will come away disappointed.  I cannot recommend this title without major, major caveats.

Games back then were made to keep you there and were well crafted to give the player a feeling of accomplishment after you beat each level.

THIS P.O.S. REMINDS ME OF HOW BAD GAMES GET AFTER A BEATIFUL SERIES GOES UNDER!

what happened to building your base up and and having to mine for resorces while being gunned down by your enimies. what happened to kane being the coolest vilian ever in C&C. what happened to the stratagy that was suppose to be in this game. why do i hvae to level up to use my whole arsenal. why did they disable wasd as the camera controls, using the mouse and having to use shortcuts without having a place to start from on the keyboard sucks. the graphics are cool but why would developers EVER put graphics befor the story or game play.

this game is a flop and should just be buried along with E.T. in a big landfill.

this game is a horrible sequal to a grand series.

this game is the killer of the C&C Series.

the only way out is to make another red alert and the third one was pushing it. besides we are tired of red alert and ww2 based games; or at least i am.

good bye C&C this game just ended our relationship.

what happened to building your base up and and having to mine for resorces while being gunned down by your enimies. what happened to kane being the coolest vilian ever in C&C. what happened to the stratagy that was suppose to be in this game. why do i hvae to level up to use my whole arsenal. why did they disable wasd as the camera controls, using the mouse and having to use shortcuts without having a place to start from on the keyboard sucks. the graphics are cool but why would developers EVER put graphics befor the story or game play.

this game is a flop and should just be buried along with E.T. in a big landfill.

this game is a horrible sequal to a grand series.

this game is the killer of the C&C Series.

the only way out is to make another red alert and the third one was pushing it. besides we are tired of red alert and ww2 based games; or at least i am.

good bye C&C this game just ended our relationship.

column8:
DO NOT BUY. I am a big Command and Conquer fan this game is just a big steaming pile of whale blubber, spending $19.99 is too generous for this game.

Cons:
No more base builder
Stupid and short story
$19.99 as a price tag
Does not feel like a true Command and Conquer game
Did I mention took away build a base and no longer need to farm resources

Pros:
Makes you really want to play and love Command and Conquer 3 , Generals , Red Alert.
Invest your money in a better Command and Conquer and not this one.

column8:
Okay, it's a good game, I like it, but if it's the Command & Conquer series you're hoping to find playing this, you're going to be disappointed.
I love the concept of having a support/defence/offense mobile bases.
You have to collect tiberium by simply picking it up, which is weird. You have an insanely low limit of units and defense if you're playing with someone, even if alone.
I like the game, but it shouldn't have been a part of the C&C series
column9:

I like the game, but it shouldn't have been a part of the C&C series

It would be hard to say whether this game shall be recommended or not, I will say 5/10. BUT DO NOT WASTE MONEY ON IT. 

Pros:
-Fun new units and elements to test and greater visuals comparing to CC3. The plot may be too short but is reasonable. Blue tiberium core upgrades are fun to try out. 
-Great, epic music.

Cons:
-Cartoonish visual effects, an unpleasant retrogress to the realistic CC3 feeling.
-Very short campaign length. The only bonus campaign require preorder, but it was 6 years ago and unable to download or purchase via DLC. 
-Scrins did not come back as it was assumed, which disappointed many players. 
-Gaming balance is totally destroyed. Weapon types have be significantly simplified and units turned out to be lot harder to kill, which require lesser micros and strategies for good matches. 
-Need no resource to produce units. It is a very controversial change, as it makes no sense.
-Require online network for gaming, but afaik EA is going to shut it down someday nevertheless.

Personally I do not disagree with this new yet controversial building quenes applied in this game, but producing units without the need of resources simply won't make sence for gaming balance and result in lot of TR vs. TR

Guess EA won't continue on CC anymore.

column8:
So I am a massive fan of the Command and conquer games and I heard about this game and simply had to try it, something i regret. First off this is not a sequal to an amazing game this is barley even command and conquer. There is no base building, no resource gathering, the community is dead, and this game is SO over priced its not even worth your time as a F2P game, and im one of the suckers that got tricked into buying it for 20 bucks, yeah i feel real stupid, please please please do not buy this game take that 20 dollars and buy one of the previous games in the series that is a true command and conquer game this is not CnC this is EAs attempt to squeeze as much money out of a game as they possibly can. And wtf is wrong with the Super dedicated Rock Paper Sissors style of units? it would be fine if they had COUNTER UNITS that could take on 2 diffrent types at once but there isn't its all just one unit ment to counter another no versatility and that breaks the game it means you just wasted alot of time building one type of unit to counter what you thought the enemy had only to realize he changed his army and before you say OH JUST BUILD A BUNCH OF DIFFRENT UNITS that won't work because you really do need an army of one type of unit to have any impact on the enemy, you could use that stratigy like i tried to but it simply fell apart and i was fighting bots at the time, the class system was interesting for 2 minutes till i found out aggressive support or campy defense is the best way to win. Here are my pros and cons

Pros (the few the proud)
Its a newer take on a stratigy game.

It adds new units to the game.

Works well enough with friends.

I had no lag issues and minimal game crashs.

Fast unistall.

Cons (here we go)
Nothing like any of the other CnC games so I simply can't label it as CnC.

There are no counter units meaning you just have to guess what the enemy is building and build units accordingly.

No base building and no resource gathering which is the corner stone of the CnC universe in terms of gameplay.

Some units are either broken op or so underwelming its just stupid (like the commandos that used to be badass).

Its way over priced.

Gameplay is increadably repetative.

Graphics are subpar to say the least.

The story is the weakest the CnC series has ever had.

If you do play with people its either a steam rolling support that focuses damage or rushing assault. 

There is no balancing in my opinion between the classes. 

No more fight the enemy to the death its now just who can get the most points by capturing points of intrest around the map ( the very limited amounts of maps).

Slow install.

Summary
EA once again found a series everyone loved and worrshipped and decided to destroy is for the sake of money the game is simply not fun its over priced its not CnC, I understand a game needs to evolve but you do need to keep those core elements in the game that make it that game something the devs don't understand and btw at this point in time the game is hacker central so if you do for some reason decide to buy this game have fun with that. 2/10 DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

Kane ist tot - Kane lebt - leider ist er der einzige, der noch etwas mit Command & Conquer zu tun hat.

Nach vielen Jahren habe ich mir fÃ¼r 5 EUR dieses letzte PuzzlestÃ¼ck zu der tollen Tiberium-Reihe gekÃ¶nnt, allen Unkenrufen zum Trotz... War ich seit Alarmstufe Rot vÃ¶llig begeistert und habe seit den spÃ¤ten 90er Jahren alle C&C samt Addons regelmÃ¤ÃŸig gerne gespielt - sowohl die Missionen, als auch im Mehrspieler-GeplÃ¤nkel.

RA 1 +2Addons - strategisch eines der besten
RA 2 +1Addon - das witzigste und einfachste zu "Modden" und mit FA2 zu "mappen"
RA 3 +1Addon - hier schlÃ¤gt es schon eine seltsame Richtung ein, allerdings gibt es eine super Mod, die Alarmstufe Rot 1 quasi auf die neue Engine portiert - top.
TD +1Addon - muss ich sagen, hat mich nie so begeistert, die Mechanik in RA war besser. Storytechnisch aber auch gut.
TS +1Addon - sowohl TiberianSun, als auch Firestorm sind meine absolute Favoriten, da strategisch mehr niemals mehr geboten wurde. Ver#nderbares Terrain, Untergrundeinheiten etc. Geiles Spiel - auch heute noch.
TW +1Addon - Meiner Meinung nach ist das der letzte Teil, der Tiberium-Saga, sowohl StorymÃ¤ÃŸig als auch grafisch und von der Mechanik. Die Dystopie aus TS/FS fehlt leider manchmal, aber dennoch ein sehr gutes Spiel.
Renegade und Generals lasse ich mal auÃŸen vor, da erstes ein FPS und zweites ein relativ realistisches gutes RTS-Game ist, aber mit CnC ebenfalls nicht wirklich etwas gemein hat.

=== Command & Conquer IV - Tiberian Twilight ===

Nach drei Stunden bereuhe ich den Kauf und mÃ¶chte nicht mehr alles wiederholen, was bereits x Mal geschrieben wurde....

Kurzum:
Alles(!) was Command & Conquer ausgemacht hat, fehlt hier. Zwar wurde das seinerzeit zu Generals auch gesagt, doch Generals war ein echtes RTS - was man von TiberianTwilight nicht mal behaupten kann. Drei ProduktionsstÃ¤tten und irgendein mit XP-Punkten versehende Logik um Einheiten (begrenzt) bauen zu kÃ¶nnen. WÃ¤re kein Joe C. "Kane" anwesend, in den wenigen Sequenzen, wÃ¼sste man nicht, dass man ein CnC in HÃ¤nden hÃ¤lt.

DÃ¤mlich, nicht mal 5 EUR wert. Traurig, dass der gute Name von den Westwood Studios fÃ¼r dieses Machwerk missbraucht wurde. Wo CnC nun steht, wissen wir - im Regal bzw. als billiger Abklatsch als Free-To-Play-Variante...
This has to be the WORST entry into the Command & Conquer series.  Only play it if you want to experience what it's like to rub lemons in your eyes.

column8:
Why fix what ain't broken? Seriously. EA killed the series. 

Cons: 
1. No base building/ tiberium harvesting= loss of the rts feel. What I mean by this is that 4 is more for the starcraft spam multiplayer than anyone else. Without base building or real tiberium harvesting where every purchase is much more impacting in the long meta of a mission, everything here becomes a rock paper scissors contest of what you can deploy to counter 1 to 2 enemy crawlers. Without base building the story also seems totally rushed.
2. The story is terrible. Either way you end up really lossing and with the worst cliff hanger that implies EA not progressing the story past this game. Its like we began with Turtledove, rich in universe detail and description with Tiberium Dawn thru tiberium sun while forgoing character development. then in 3 we hit an SM Stirling kind of narrative with really indepth background about the universe, annecdotes about characters like Havoc from Renegade, and crazy battlefields like red zones and yellow. Then we hit this...this slop. If you are here for the story I suggest you find it elsewhere for Tiberium Twilight will make you hate yourself. 
3. Multiplayer is stupid unbalanced due to unit unlocks versus experience. If you're a new player online prepare to have your first majority of battles to be like Dark Souls; lots of death and much frustration as you have tier I and maybe tier II while your opponent has tier III and more. It's going to be a bad time. hint just rush support. Air OP. 
4. Still too expensive for how bad it is. 

Pros: 
1. Kane is back. Kane backstabs GDI. 
2. Scrin towers actually are explained.
3. Missions are generally quick.

So i've loved Command & Conquer for years, since i was just a kid, but after playing a good hour of this i realized how much the original makers had to sacrifice to give what they could in this final installment. Every new game should have things that make you feel like it's new, and they've gotten feedback, worked with ideas, and have dished out the best they could come up with. This game, saddly, feels like an RTS rendition of a game from the early 2000's. I really wish those who worked on the game had the money and/or cared enough to make this last installment a great success, and a game that would leave a good lasting memory from a series that was the foundation of the childhoods of severl individuals. Fuck EA. I'm so enraged that i care little to look over my comment for any errors.

column8: I love the C&C series but this game is everything wrong with the triple A world. Take a game of base building and unit tactics and make the bases mobile and units unlock as you level up. Also giving bland control points is a patronizing pat on the head to the RTS fans that can tell what is important in a map to control.

This is the worst game I've ever played.  It haunts me, sitting in my steam lists, even uninstalled.  This was the death-knell of Command & Conquer, a venerable franchise that spanned many great games over a decade, and it is physically painful to know it ends with this.  

This game is a failure on every level.  I bought it on sale out of morbid curiosity, and I regret that decision.  Do not make my mistake.

column8:
This has to be about the worst C&C title there is... No, I take that back, IT IS THE WORST.  It's like taking the concept of Unreal Tournament with the "spawn, run, kill, die, repead" mentality and popping it into a "stratigy" game.  There is no stratigy in either.  Basically make troops, toss them to their doom and repeat.  No real base building, no real stratigy, get C&C 3, or 2...

I have no idea what crack rock they smoked to come up with this game but it was some bad stuff mang.

Si vous Ãªtes fan de la sÃ©rie C&C, n'acheter pas cet opus, car vous allez Ãªtre aussi triste que si on vous dit que vos parents sont morts. Le plus gros problÃ¨me selon moi est l'absense total d'un vrai gameplay de C&C comme on aime.

PremiÃ¨rement, les unitÃ©s ne vienne pas de la mÃªme faÃ§on que les autres opus. Dans cette merde, vous devez montez votre niveau global du jeu pour avoir les meilleurs unitÃ©s et amÃ©liorations d'unitÃ©s. Donc si vous Ãªtes nouveau Ã  ce jeu et que vous jouez en ligne contre un joueur niveau max, vous allez en chier une bonne. En plus, votre niveau ''global'' n'est pas vraiment global, car votre lvl augmente seulement dans la faction dont vous jouez. C'est Ã  dire que si vous jouez avec le GDI, le Nod va rester Ã  son niveau actuel. 

DeuxiÃ¨mement, vous n'avez QU'UNE SEULE structure. Vous ne pouvez pas construire par exemple des centrales pour votre Ã©nergie parce que vous en avez pas besoin. Les seules structure qu'on peut fabriquer sont les tourelles et autres dÃ©fenses. Autrement dit, tout ce fait avec votre unique base (appelÃ© Crawler) : crÃ©ation d'unitÃ©, amÃ©lioration, etc... et sÃ©rieusement, je trouve cela vraiment mÃ©diocre.

Finalement, le truc qu'on a tous besoin dans tous les RTS est bien sÃ»r la gestion des ressources. Dans ce jeu, il n'y en a pas. Le tiberium, seule ressource du jeu, n'existe plus. D'accord j'avoue qu'il en a encore dans le jeux, mais Ã§a sert seulement Ã  faire avancÃ© vos amÃ©lioration plus rapidement. les parties ressemblent plus Ã  du spam de crÃ©ation d'unitÃ©. La stratÃ©gie n'existe plus dans C&C 4.

Pour conclure, ce jeu est mauvais. Il y a d'autre chose que je n'ai pas parlÃ© comme la sorte de classe que vous pouvez prendre: attaque, dÃ©fense et soutien. Je trouve cette idÃ©e vraiment nulle, parce que vous n'avez pas toutes les variations d'unitÃ© (exemple : pour avoir des unitÃ©s aÃ©riennes il faut Ãªtre soutien). Franchement, j'avais achetÃ© cet opus seulement pour connaÃ®tre le reste de l'histoire, mais j'ai pas rÃ©ussi Ã  le finir Ã  cause du gameplay pourri qui me dÃ©goÃ»te. MÃªme en rabais je le dÃ©conseille. Ce jeu est la dÃ©finition mÃªme de la dÃ©ception.

Not only is this game the biggest piece of rubbish ever created, but it does one of the most unethical things.  After exiting the game it keeps itself "running" on steam to falsely increase the hours played.  I played this for only 30 minutes and it says 95 hours now.

Avoid this junk like the plague.  It is poorly put together and has no bearing on the command and conquer universe.  This game is honestly worse quality than bad cell phone games.

A total rip-off.  Useless.  Rubbish.  Junk.  No redeeming feature whatsoever.  Trash.  Excrement.  Makes me want to vomit.

0 / 10

column8: Absolutely nothing like Command and Conquer should be. Wish I did some research into what the game actually was. I'd personally say the C&C series should be embarassed to have this title wearing its name. Horrible interface, shoddy graphics and nothing what a C&C RTS interface should represent. No real base development or resource gathering interaction, just a slapped together quick point and click time waster that is better suited to be offered in a phone APP store, not a PC title. Definitely dissapointed.

column8: Kein Vergleich zu den vorherigen Games... eine regelrechte EnttÃ¤uschung.

The skirmish is decent though it's quite different from that in CNC series, kinda reminds me of the Colosseum.

The campaign, however, is extremely rediculous in the following aspects:
[olist]
    [*]For a new-player, you really shouldn't begin with the Campaign, since you need to unlock some crucial units to complete a specific level.
    [*]The lack of variety. Generally there's only one tactic  towards a campaign.
    [*]A bit more difficult even for senior-players of  CNCs.
[/olist]
In that, no one deserves this. But if you are a fan of CNC and fond in RTS arena, try this just as well...

How can EA live with themselves after making such a crap game? They should have just redesigned one of the old C&C game with better graphics and mechanics.

This game would probably be a little fun as an android/ios indie game. But it certainly doesn't count as a full game. I cry diamonds for those who were ignorant enough to purchase this at its original price. 

I was playing and playing and playing for me to get to a part where I can actually build a base and harvest tiberium. Little did I know there wasn't any and I was ripped off of my Â£3. I wouldn't even play this if they paid me to.

This is not your typical C&C by any means, the rumors say that this was EA's attempt to push C&C to eSports, but because market was overwhelmed by MOBAs and other quality RTS games, they decided to slap 4 and ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE story on it to lure in loyal C&C fans, and the final product we have now does look and play exactly like it was initially planned to be. The only reason i give this game a positive rating is because i had a tons of fun and positive memories playing it with my friends in coop/compstomp and just skirmish with AI. If you play this game without thinking about past C&C games, it's actually fine, runs great, plays great, looks great. Let's do a breakdown :

Reasons to buy it [b][i]( only if it's on huge sale[strike] and you are desperate[/strike] )[/i][/b] :

 - Tons of fun in COOP with friends or vs AI alone.
 - Very pretty environmental/map design.
 - Sometimes it's very challenging.
 - Visuals.
 - 5v5 players possible.

Reasons to avoid it and tell me that i am stupid for giving it a positive rating :

 - Abysmal plot written by a madman in a few hours. Probably taken from DeviantArt fanfiction section.
 - Questionable units design.
 - Horrible FMV actors performance.
 - There is almost no way to beat campaign alone, it's designed to be beaten in COOP.
 - Unit cap.
 - Has almost nothing to do with C&C, hence no base building or tiberium harvesting.
 - The ending cutscene ( which is the finale of whole C&C series presumably ) is so horrible that you might want to kys after it.
 - Most of the super/special weapons feel weak.
 - You need to unlock units in order to use them.


If reasons to avoid it don't scare you + it's on a huge sale and you have a friend to play it with - then you might want to get it just for collection and full playthrough with people you know. If you're looking for extra content for it - don't. Game doesn't have mod support, but it does have few custom maps.

But if you want some more good old C&C - don't get it, it's not C&C, it won't be fun for you, infact it might leave you with few dead brain cells, just like me.

 - Has almost nothing to do with C&C, hence no base building or tiberium harvesting.
 - The ending cutscene ( which is the finale of whole C&C series presumably ) is so horrible that you might want to kys after it.
 - Most of the super/special weapons feel weak.
 - You need to unlock units in order to use them.


If reasons to avoid it don't scare you + it's on a huge sale and you have a friend to play it with - then you might want to get it just for collection and full playthrough with people you know. If you're looking for extra content for it - don't. Game doesn't have mod support, but it does have few custom maps.

But if you want some more good old C&C - don't get it, it's not C&C, it won't be fun for you, infact it might leave you with few dead brain cells, just like me.

column8:
My original review in Jan 2016 was very negative due to the game simply not working and so I got a full refund from steam.
In Nov 2017, I paid 63 cent for the game in a sale and it worked fine once I'd input the game key, created a profile at EA games and logged in and played for a couple of hours... here's what I found:

The UI is a thing of nightmares and so full of glitches, you'd need Yuri Prime's psychic ability to directly access the developers mind on how it works.
The game perspective is so near, with a zoom so limited, that you can only go from viewing nasal hair, out to the blackheads covering the nose of a particularly grubby Zone-trooper.
Not that viewing the game is necessary as only being able to produce a handful of units, buildings, etc. due to the tiny resource caps, that you may as well keep the mouse button constantly clicking to make new units as the old ones get destroyed as soon as they emerge.
As for unit capabilities, you can go from nerf to fluffy kitten in a single bound, rendering the entire enterprise as challenging as going for a poo having eaten six buckets of yogurt.
Not that you should bother playing the game at all, as the concept of game-play seems to have eluded the developers who must have been so high on LSD they thought a table leg was interesting.
Thinking on it, I'm embarrassed for the video actors, some of who were in previous C&C incarnations and acted their hearts out in this one, only for it to be a total disgrace.
Oh and by the way â€“ I WANT MY 63 CENT BACK!
column9:
My original review in Jan 2016 was very negative due to the game simply not working and so I got a full refund from steam.
In Nov 2017, I paid 63 cent for the game in a sale and it worked fine once I'd input the game key, created a profile at EA games and logged in and played for a couple of hours... here's what I found:

The UI is a thing of nightmares and so full of glitches, you'd need Yuri Prime's psychic ability to directly access the developers mind on how it works.
The game perspective is so near, with a zoom so limited, that you can only go from viewing nasal hair, out to the blackheads covering the nose of a particularly grubby Zone-trooper.
Not that viewing the game is necessary as only being able to produce a handful of units, buildings, etc. due to the tiny resource caps, that you may as well keep the mouse button constantly clicking to make new units as the old ones get destroyed as soon as they emerge.
As for unit capabilities, you can go from nerf to fluffy kitten in a single bound, rendering the entire enterprise as challenging as going for a poo having eaten six buckets of yogurt.
Not that you should bother playing the game at all, as the concept of game-play seems to have eluded the developers who must have been so high on LSD they thought a table leg was interesting.
Thinking on it, I'm embarrassed for the video actors, some of who were in previous C&C incarnations and acted their hearts out in this one, only for it to be a total disgrace.
Oh and by the way â€“ I WANT MY 63 CENT BACK!

column8:
Having played this game before, I personally would not suggest this game to a Command & Conquer fan because the game is way too different, for example, there's no more base building anymore, the game could be good if it would at least have that.
The Scrins were In my opinion, a nice addition to the Command & Conquer Tiberian series but they decided not to add it on this game which is pretty dumb In my opinion.
You should buy this game only if you tell yourself that this game is NOT a Command & Conquer and if you you don't care about this game not being complexe, the game's pretty easy actually unlike the previous games.
It could have been great but It is not, It feels like they've rushed everything about this game.
4/10
Hopefully we'll see some new Command & Conquer games that are good and much more like the previous ones and hopefully no online DRM or Origin crap...
But wait... It won't happen so I'd simply suggest you to play the older Command & Conquer games that are unfortunately only on Origin (except for Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wrath, Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath, Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3 and Command & Conquer Red Alert 3 - Uprising.
Not counting this one because this game is NOT a Command & Conquer game.
Command & Conquer 3: Red Alert was not as great as the previous ones but they are still fun unlike this, you're not too sure what to do with it after having finishing it at least once.

column8:
If ur expecting a game similar to the older ones, this will fuck u.
U have ur small base, trops and stuff, there is three types of bases u can choose (And switch to in game)
Attack - Attack units (Tanks)
Defence - Footsoldiers, for bunkers and attack. and towers/bunkers.
Suport - Units, mostly repair/heal. some attack. Powers - repair, clocking and stuff (global)

There is a lvl system, so to play with others prepair to grind your way to lvl 20.
They dont even let u join costum games if youre low lvl.

Campain is kinda stupid.
Do this task - get constantly attacked.
You are overrun constantly by shit, and as far as i can tell, GDI campain seems easier than Nods.
Difference between Easy and normal aint that big.
Its practikaly the same, One map there spawned one few less mega tanks to attack me.
Another there spawned few less air suport for a target.

Not saying im bad, well might be true to thou. But ur so limited.

Sure whould be fun to play costom, but theres so few games and they dont let u join. (since i havent grinded enugh and not finished the boring campain yet)

Dont recomend it. If it aint broke dont fix it, and they broke the game. Loved the old RTS games.

column8:
That is a sad truth that both players and the C&C series itself have been stripped off of its well deserved proper ending. EA created a chimera (apparently trying to take likeness of the other RTS titles) forgetting that this game has been an icon and should not be so awfully transformed. Thus dies C&C from house Westwood.

Adding injury to insult the new hybrid of a game is not even enjoyable to play. Tactics and strategy were limited to just positioning your mobile base and produce produce produce units. No money means just keeping the number of units at maximum and trying to utilize their not so useful abilities to win a mini skirmish after another in hope of reaching the mobile (sic!) enemy base to destroy it. The process gets boring after an hour of gameplay. On easy, the AI is practically dormant. On normal, computer produces units all the time that it becomes overwhelming.

I won't rate multiplayer as I dont care about it. I wanted a good and fitting story to end a legendary plot. What did we get? A slap in the face. They might as well just put the credits at the beginning and be done with it. A MAJOR disappointment. I hope someone picks up the torch where C&C 3 left it. Kane WILL be back.
column9:
That is a sad truth that both players and the C&C series itself have been stripped off of its well deserved proper ending. EA created a chimera (apparently trying to take likeness of the other RTS titles) forgetting that this game has been an icon and should not be so awfully transformed. Thus dies C&C from house Westwood.

Adding injury to insult the new hybrid of a game is not even enjoyable to play. Tactics and strategy were limited to just positioning your mobile base and produce produce produce units. No money means just keeping the number of units at maximum and trying to utilize their not so useful abilities to win a mini skirmish after another in hope of reaching the mobile (sic!) enemy base to destroy it. The process gets boring after an hour of gameplay. On easy, the AI is practically dormant. On normal, computer produces units all the time that it becomes overwhelming.

I won't rate multiplayer as I dont care about it. I wanted a good and fitting story to end a legendary plot. What did we get? A slap in the face. They might as well just put the credits at the beginning and be done with it. A MAJOR disappointment. I hope someone picks up the torch where C&C 3 left it. Kane WILL be back.

column8:
This is a horrible end to a great series. I couldnt even play the second mission, it was sadly just that bad. THe graphics are horribly downgraded. The armor system is horrible, they removed base building from a base building game. You have to unlock90% of th eunits you would use in game. And the gam eplay is closer to top down tactics and not a true strategy.
On the plus side, oh wait there isn't one.

column8:
After hearing all the bad reviews about this I thought I would reserve judgement until I played it myself. 

All I can say is this game was a huge disappointing way to end the tiberium storyline, the familar C&C controls including base biuliding are now gone and replaced with some sort of moving base which spawns units at a cost. 

Summarised in one one, BAD!

column8: While I love all C&C games, this one kind of bites the bullet...the game play is more mobile than any of the previous ones, there is no base building, there are no super weapons. You have a central mobile base that builds units and are capped based on how many/what type of units you currently have active. If you are new to the C&C universe, DO NOT start here. Go with one of the more classic ones.

column8:
[h1]TL;DR? See Conclusion[/h1]

[h1]NOTE: Related Content[/h1]
Also see my:
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/24790/]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars Review[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/24810]Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath Review[/url]

[h1]INTRODUCTION:[/h1]
Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight is a real-time strategy game developed and published by Electronic Arts. This title serves as the official sequel to the critically acclaimed C&C 3: Tiberium Wars  and acts as the final chapter in the decade and a half long Command & Conquer Tiberian franchise.

[h1]PLOT (No Spoilers):[/h1]
The story picks up 15 years after the end of Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath. The Scrin has been defeated, Kane has successfully recovered the Tacitus and the Brotherhood of NOD is merely a shadow of its former self. Despite the Scrin's failed invasion, all is not well as Tiberium now spreads in an ever more rapid rate and human extinction is almost inevitable. The game starts with Kane offering the remaining world leaders a solution to this problem.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
+ Return of live action cinematics but...(See CON #1)
+ Good sound effects and voice acting
+ Interesting veterancy system with visual upgrade changes for each level of veterancy
+ Good special effects and graphics (but average art style)
+ Interesting new units

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=522954423]Poor costume quality for the live action cutscenes[/url]
- No base building
- No resource gathering
- DRM Stacking (Always Online + Log-in requirement every time you start the game)
- Unlock and account level up system that ruins the game's unit availability: (meaning you can't jump to multiplayer immediately because half of your units are locked.)
- Population Cap
- The game is lore deficient, with a rushed and confusing story
- Poorly written and poorly executed attempt to establish â€œemotional depthâ€ by giving the Commander a wife that most players won't care about.
- Lack of mission variety and the fun stealth missions were completely removed
- No side bar like the old games; the entire UI looks bad as a whole
- Too much deviation from the C&C source material meaning it neither look nor feel like a C&C game
- Ridiculously low damage and high HP for every unit that results in...(See next CON)
- VERY slow paced action
- Pathfinding problems
- Severe balance issues
- Very short campaign time
- Small and poorly designed campaign maps
- The game as a whole feels rushed and cheap

[h1]NEUTRAL:[/h1]
+/- The 'Crawler / MCV' unit building system is an interesting idea but it shouldn't have been implemented on an already existing franchise such as C&C because it already has an established (and working) formula.

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
A [b]VERY BAD[/b] sequel which stands as an insult to the fans of a 15 year old franchise. In EA's attempt to â€œinnovate,â€ they failed to see what made the Command and Conquer games fun for a lot of people.

[h1]WORTH IT?[/h1]
[b]NO,[/b] the game is not worth it. I would [b]not recommend[/b] this game to anyone even on a sale, specially if you're a fan of the old games. You're better off buying the previous titles like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24790/]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars[/url] and its [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24810/]expansion[/url].

[h1]FINAL NOTES:[/h1]
I would have been kinder in my criticism of this game if it did not have the Command and Conquer name on it. Tiberian Twilight would have sold better and would have been received better by the community if it was merely a spin-off rather than the finale of the franchise.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kFXJaYY0TOs]This video[/url] expresses clearly what I feel about this game.

--------------------------------------------------------- 
[h1]Like my Reviews? Follow my Curator's Page:[/h1]

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861651-Miyumi%27s-Review-Corner/]Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)[/url]

+ Interesting veterancy system with visual upgrade changes for each level of veterancy
+ Good special effects and graphics (but average art style)
+ Interesting new units

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=522954423]Poor costume quality for the live action cutscenes[/url]
- No base building
- No resource gathering
- DRM Stacking (Always Online + Log-in requirement every time you start the game)
- Unlock and account level up system that ruins the game's unit availability: (meaning you can't jump to multiplayer immediately because half of your units are locked.)
- Population Cap
- The game is lore deficient, with a rushed and confusing story
- Poorly written and poorly executed attempt to establish â€œemotional depthâ€ by giving the Commander a wife that most players won't care about.
- Lack of mission variety and the fun stealth missions were completely removed
- No side bar like the old games; the entire UI looks bad as a whole
- Too much deviation from the C&C source material meaning it neither look nor feel like a C&C game
- Ridiculously low damage and high HP for every unit that results in...(See next CON)
- VERY slow paced action
- Pathfinding problems
- Severe balance issues
- Very short campaign time
- Small and poorly designed campaign maps
- The game as a whole feels rushed and cheap

[h1]NEUTRAL:[/h1]
+/- The 'Crawler / MCV' unit building system is an interesting idea but it shouldn't have been implemented on an already existing franchise such as C&C because it already has an established (and working) formula.

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
A [b]VERY BAD[/b] sequel which stands as an insult to the fans of a 15 year old franchise. In EA's attempt to â€œinnovate,â€ they failed to see what made the Command and Conquer games fun for a lot of people.

[h1]WORTH IT?[/h1]
[b]NO,[/b] the game is not worth it. I would [b]not recommend[/b] this game to anyone even on a sale, specially if you're a fan of the old games. You're better off buying the previous titles like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24790/]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars[/url] and its [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24810/]expansion[/url].

[h1]FINAL NOTES:[/h1]
I would have been kinder in my criticism of this game if it did not have the Command and Conquer name on it. Tiberian Twilight would have sold better and would have been received better by the community if it was merely a spin-off rather than the finale of the franchise.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kFXJaYY0TOs]This video[/url] expresses clearly what I feel about this game.

--------------------------------------------------------- 
[h1]Like my Reviews? Follow my Curator's Page:[/h1]

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861651-Miyumi%27s-Review-Corner/]Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)[/url]

column8:
As a child... I played starcraft. I got rekked repeatedly. Shrek couldn't have rekked me better. It was awesome.
Then I played Age of Empires. I was maybe 7, and didn't have to use cheats to win finally.
Then Civilization came, and I finally started to understand strategy.
Then I started playing C&C... I got really good, and my computer could just barely run it and life was great.

I noticed this game on here, and thought.. "Hey, why not give a nod to my childhood and play another rts, I even liked the console one a little, so this should be great!"
I tried.
I really really tried. That was just...
I. Have. No. Words.
I opened a skirmish to learn ( Screw tutorials), and just... What have they done. There were no buildings. You literally make engineers, move your giant walking building spider thingy to the objective... And then crap out a ton more people.
This made me sad. This is the worst thing I have ever seen as far as "rts" goes.

CoD has more strategy to it than this. You disgust me EA.

column8:
Command and Conquer was a classic in the RTS genre. You build a base, expand, create troops, etc...then strategically move to take out your opponents.

If you love Command and Conquer, RTS games, or...games in general, I guess, then stay away from C&C4. It's not even a game, it's a joke. It's so far from the rest of the series, it's mind-boggling, and not only because it plays nothing like them, but because the other games are great and this one is practically unplayable.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this game.

column8:
Besides what most people say, I like this. 

Ok, maybe it was a really bold step to go with such a new concept in a so well known and well established game series. The story of Kain is finished with this one, with an ending I really can approve. The singleplayer is also playable in coop, which makes in a little bit too easy in my opinion.

The multiplayer is still challenging, because you get to coordinate in larger teams. The game is fast and the two factions are well balanced.

column8: Ce jeux n'a aucun intÃ©rrÃ©, ya plus de base a contruire, l'histoire est encore plus dÃ©bile qu'avant. passez votre chemin.

I have been a fan of strategy games for a very long time.  Im a casual player and stick to single player vs ai and campaign themes games.  I was hugely impressed by C&C 3 and enjoyed the Red Alert Series and Generals.  Sadly C&C 4 is a terrible addition to the series.  It adds a confusing system of a mobile base with the ability to generate units on the fly but the system itself is flawed and the game play and visuals are poorly executed.  The campaign missions are confusing and later levels are extremely frustrating because the AI knows what units to utilize and what works while you are trying to get units to work.  Then you have vehicle units that have an ability that requires you to manually reload their weapon so instead of unleashing them and leaving them alone to focus on other events you need to babysit them to make them reload and its not like they have a large cash of ammo but like 30 or so rounds tops and can go through that almost instantly.  Do not get this unless you wish to suffer through the incompetent gameplay to finish the Tiberium storyline, because even i couldnt.

column8:
I did see that EA made this sequel to the brutal C&C saga and I was sceptic at first, but said why not. After the first 5 minutes of gameplay and visiting the armory (yes, you do have to level up to gain access to units, upgrades, etc) I was even more sceptic. Spent another 5 minutes on the "tutorial" mission and I was utterly surprised. It's magical to see EA ruin yet another game which came, as I said, from a brutal saga in which I enjoyed all the other titles. GJ EA and keep up the good work, not gonna buy any game with your signature on it!

P.S. Windows 8.1 users have fun setting up the game with the graphic settings, took me around 20 minutes for it since it crashed all the time while changing settings (which was less than adequate with options). Oh and I do run GTA V and Witcher 3 on max graphics so my PC isn't an issue for this bit.

column8:
Okay so i have been a fan of C&C for about 20 years now and I can safely say this is THE most disapointing title I have ever played.

I'll start with a positive though I did like the asthetic, It wasn't half bad, The nod didn't look quite how I'd expect them to but overall it was okay. However that is the only positive I have about the game and not a very strong one at that, now for the negatives.

Lets start with the most glaringly obvious one which i think everyone feels the same and that's the campaign... This had to be written by some emotionless, imbecilic monkey. It literally starts off going THIS NAMELESS CHARACTER IS YOUR WIFE CARE ABOUT HER!!!! (uhhh okay???) Okay seriously why would I care about this character, I've literally never seen them before but the game just expects you to care about her and really really obnoxiously tries shove it down your throat it's insane because aboviously they're going to use her as a plot device. I think a bloody 5 year old can figure that out.
The campaign is insanely short as well I completed the whole thing in about 2.5 hours, that's it... the whole thing.. and like an hour of it is a tutorial. It ends so suddenly as well I was like wait is that it. I just did like 4 missions after the tutorial crap and then poof, done, over. I can only imagine that they were planning on bringing out a tonne of garbage DLC for this just to unlock more campaign missions.

Now for the Gameplay... 
It's terrible just flat out terrible, it's watered down from other games and lacks any sort of depth or strategy.
This is literally it it, You start off with your main "structure" called a Crawler, now you move your crawler to whatever objective you have which is either one of 3 things: Capture thing, kill thing or Defend thing. (defending thing being the most annoying since you have no control over said thing it will generally just run into things and get itself killed, it's like "Hay you know what would be a fun idea, lets walk face first into that big horde of enemies over there. I'm sure things will be completely fine!"). Now as I was saying here's what the gameplay is: Move Crawler to objective, Deploy Crawler, Throw shit at problem until it goes away, move to next objective. That's it, that's all I did, I didn't have to care about what units I built since all i had to do is build the spider tanks with the big ass tesla coil and throw them at the enemy, I didn't even have to worry about them dying since if you build like 3 or 4 engineers everything you have is pretty much immortal anyway. i didn't even have to worry about my base since there's no base building to worry about and the base came with me anyway so screw defenses. Oh and for tech it's literally hay see that red crystal over there? yeah pic that up like 1 or 2 of them and you can INSTANTLY unlock every single bit of tech you want.

So that's it that's C&C 4 in all it's terribleness. The only way I could possibly recommend this game is to play it just to see how bad it is.

ich habe zwar nur bischen Ã¼ber 2 stunden gespielt aber mir reicht es! Ich habe die schnauze voll von diesen "game".

Jeder der C&C liebt sollte sich diesen teil nicht kaufen weil es einfach kein C&C ist.

Einheiten limit - seit wann das? Das geht gar nicht !!!!!
Taktik - brauchst du keine, man muss nur darauf achten das immer einheiten gebaut werden.
Grafik - war schon viel besser (achtung, Augenkrebsgefahr :-/ ).
Musik - die musik ist einfach eine endlosschleife die gefÃ¼hlt 10 sekunden sich zu wiederholen scheint.
Sounds - war schon viel besser
Interface - viele SchaltflÃ¤chen die man erst benutzen darf wenn man weiter ist.
Die Einheiten - QuantitÃ¤t statt QualitÃ¤t so sieht ein futuristischer Krieg sicher nicht aus (nicht vergessen 50 Einheiten limit, 5 Panzer und schluss). Meiner meinung viel zu viele verschiedene Typen die alle irgendwie nix drauf haben. ÃœbergroÃŸe mega Kanonen haben sie alle die minmal schaden machen (soll das witzig sein?)
Baubare GebÃ¤ude - gibt es eigentlich keine.
Gameplay - Einheiten bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen und das beste sie kosten nicht mal was weil sowas wie einen Sammler braucht man nicht weil es gar nix zu sammeln gibt!

Ne mal ganz im ernst.
Wenn ich gewusst hÃ¤tte wie sch***** (sry) der Teil von C&C ist und ich nicht so voreilig auf das Angebot reingefallen wÃ¤re, dann hÃ¤tte ich das game nie gekauft.

Command and Conquer R.I.P.
The end of awesome C&C, sadly.

column8: I would not insist on buying this game, with all due respect to EA. This game is nothing alike to C&C3 and is gravely disappointing. The entire layout of the game itself is different and suffers without the classic base-defense. I was hoping that the story would lift off after C&C3: Kane's Wrath, but it seemed to stray from the storyline itself. C&C3 is my top favorite C&C. I am happy that I bought this game for a real cheap ~4$ during this year's Summer sale. I would be furious if I wasted 20$ on this game. I would hope EA would develop a C&C5, but the "fans" insist that they don't even try and let the series die with dignity due to the horrid C&C4. If they are to make a new C&C, it would be like the classic and traditional C&C.

column8:
Ich war nie ein ausgemachter Fan der C&C-Reihe, aber in C&C 1 oder RA mal ein paar Tanks spammen und Gegner niederballern hat schon immer SpaÃŸ gemacht. Die Story war auch ganz witzig, das Technoflair stimmig, und alles in allem ein wirklich hÃ¼bsches Spiel.

Tja, jetzt war Teil 4 im Sale, und ich dachte mir, schau Dir mal an, wie C&C heute so in modern aussieht. Aber gleich vorweg - was auch immer EA aus C&C gemacht hat, es ist nicht mehr C&C...

Es gibt ein Einheitenlimit, und man kann keine Basis/GebÃ¤ude bauen - man platziert einfach sein MBF irgendwo auf einer vordefinierten FlÃ¤che, gibt ihm eine von drei taktischen Ausrichtungen (offensiv/defensiv/UnterstÃ¼tzung), und spamt dann nur noch Einheiten. Eine richtig schÃ¶ne Masse wie bei den alten Teilen kommt dank des strengen Einheitenlimits aber trotzdem nicht zusammen, und so wird einem das Leben kÃ¼nstlich schwer gemacht. TaktikverstÃ¤ndnis wird im Prinzip nicht gebraucht, es ist mehr wie ein modernes Clickergame.

Ich hatte gelesen, dass die Kampagne sehr kurz sein soll (es sind wohl 2x7 Missionen), und dachte noch, das halte ich durch. Habe jetzt bei Mission 5 aufgehÃ¶rt und werde stattdessen eine Wand streichen gehen. Der Farbe beim Trocknen zuzusehen macht nÃ¤mlich viel mehr SpaÃŸ als C&C 4...

Bleibt nur noch anzufÃ¼gen: Schade um den Klassiker. EA ist ein echter Sensenmann der Spielkultur...

column8: Das ist kein CnC! Das ist ScheiÃŸe!

I actually quite enjoyed playing this despite the bad publicity it has. Yes, EA do what they typically do and use a name to sell a game that's completely different from what is expected of it. It probably should have been an offshoot instead of a sequel. If you can ignore that then it's not that bad of a game and has no serious technical problems.

The game is basically just dumbed down and casualised RTS that's good for playing for 30 minutes. All the more complex aspects such as base and resource management are thrown away leaving you with the job of looking after 1 master unit, the Crawler. You collect Tiberium crystals to receive upgrade points and when the Crawler is destroyed it respawns at a drop off point. The Defense type can construct buildings but only buildings such as the Obelisk and Nuke/Ion Cannon which require the Crawler to be alive to operate. Support buildings can also be captured but cannot be destroyed.

I completed the campaign and played some skirmishes. The skirmish mode is a little shallow and some extra customization would have made it much better such as increasing the unit limit for games with more players. I'm going to give it a thumbs up for that at least. If you want or expect a traditional C&C experience then don't get it and stick to C&C 3 or the older games.

Do not buy this game.

Many people gave this game a bad review because the many changes in the game formula. Is fair to say that this is not a sequel to Command & Conquer, It is much more like a action strategy spin-off. 

That is not the reason why this game is bad, but here are some reasons why you should not buy it:

- Permanent online connection require to play. In the middle of the campaign EA servers went down and now i simply can't play until they decide to go back up. Now i am here, angry, writing a review.

- Requires you to login and input your password every time you start the game.

- Unskippable cutscenes

- Lack of mission variety, is most of the time build troops and walk around the map destroying everything in empty skirmishers style maps. Is really hard to believe that this game was released in the same year that Starcraft 2 came out.

- The new mechanics are really average, there is not much do to. They cut out resource collection, all you do is choose the appropriate MCV to the situation and walk with your troops.

- Units are ultra resilient. It may take minutes of firing to kill an enemy armada. Combat is not fun.

Edit: You also lost the mission progress when the game lose connection.

column8: Les commande ne sont pas digne d'un command and conquer je suis trÃ¨s dÃ©Ã§u

I played and loved Command & Conquer since the very first hour on this ol'good 486 PC. It was the early 90's.
A beloved time period. The time of Dune 2 where it was impossible to select groups, only a single unit at a time,

Westwood Studios gave birth to a new kind of gameplay called Real Time Strategy with a game whose name became legendary: Command & Conquer. The war in real time with boobs and rock music. God that was good. That... WAS... Q_Q

Came EA who made this shitty robbery called C&C4. Watched without comparison it may be an interesting game... BUT I can't watch it without comparison because of its name: COMMAND & CONQUER.

EA killed Command & Conquer and give the corpse to be raped by anyone who is clumsy enough to hope the final chapter the C&C franchise deserved. Sorry for being badly disposed like this but I was clumsy enough to believe EA would give (sell) me the C&C4 of my dreams. Instead I had a stinky cadaver wearing a "I'm with stupid -->" T-shirt.

SCREW YOU EA.
RIP Westwood Studios.

PS Excuse my probable mistakes in English which isn't my first language.

This. This is what you get when you have a Command and Conquer game...but remove everything that [b]IS[/b] a Command and Conquer game. Absolute total tosh.

No base building, no resource gathering, no huge army, you [b]HAVE[/b] to have an internet connection at all times even if you're only playing single player, small variety of units that you need to level up to gain access to in the first place...and well, you get the idea.

I tried to get into the game, I really did, but an hour is all I could manage before I made up my mind.

I've played C&C ever since RA95 and loved every other C&C game upto Kanes Wrath. RA3 wasn't [i]too[/i] bad, but it isn't really great either, Uprising again, wasn't [i]too[/i] bad, but not great.

This is just the final nail in the coffin for this franchise...or I guess in EA's terms, this game was the final check on their list of "[b]Excellent Game Franchise's to ABSOLUTELY destroy[/b]"

NotEvenWorthARating/10, as it's just that bad. Kane is [i]very[/i] disappointed.

column8:
I would rather play with a dog turd than play with this turd of a game.

A fantastic franchise ruined by EA's terrible decision making. Avoid this game at all costs, it honestly isn't worth the money and craps all over the C&C franchise (not just the tiberian universe). 

Terrible story, terrible graphics, terrible controls, no proper base building, no real strategy, cartoon style graphics, no  atmosphere, poor level design... just... overwhelmingly terrible.

Listen to the reviews, it is not worth it. Youtube the custscene videos if you want to know they how butchered the story and endings.

edit: played via origin hence no play time on steam. CD key activated on both systems.

this game was created to be the epic conclusion to the Tiberium saga...and EA failed terribly. 
they tried to change the Command & Conquer mechanics when it clearly didn't need to be changed. if it aint broke, don't fix it. while i have some fun playing this game; anyone looking for the same experience as the previous titles, you are going to be very dissapointed. i, myself am very dissapointed with this game, hopefully in the future EA will make a new C&C game that will live up to its past titles, but i doubt it. we all know what a complete f-up EA is
do not play this game.

column8: I really liked other games in the C&C series, but this one took half the game out of the equation. There is no economy, no macro game. It's all microed combat. No building, no resources. I really don't like the tech system. Campaign play is a little grindy and recycled, but if the game stayed the same but included bases and resource gathering and an econ long-game, that would be fine, but it doesn't, and I'd give it a 3/10.
column9: I really liked other games in the C&C series, but this one took half the game out of the equation. There is no economy, no macro game. It's all microed combat. No building, no resources. I really don't like the tech system. Campaign play is a little grindy and recycled, but if the game stayed the same but included bases and resource gathering and an econ long-game, that would be fine, but it doesn't, and I'd give it a 3/10.

column8:
En el 2012, me acuerdo cuando en el blog de una cosplayer de EspaÃ±a habÃ­a debatÃ­do sobre el final de Mass Effect 3, el cual le parecÃ­a injusto que el final decepcionara tanto. Yo le habÃ­a respondido "Si eso es lo Ãºnico que te ha decepcionado de EA, es porque no has visto el final de Command & Conquer 4. Eso SI que es una verdadera decepcion". Si despues de eso, no ha jugado a esto, espero haberle hecho de alguna forma un favor invirtiendo su tiempo mejor en otra cosa mas interesante, como mirar un muro, por ejemplo xD.

Lo que voy a contar lo digo desde el punto de vista de fan de la saga. Aquella franquicia que me hizo fan de PC por excelencia (mucho antes de Starcraft, Max Payne, KotOR, Medal of Honor, etc) fue, sin duda, Command & Conquer (C&C), mas o menos la 1era instancia para MS-DOS allÃ¡ por el 1995. Asi que me voy a tomar un tiempo en explicar el drama que aqueja a semejante monstruo que es esto.

Durante la franquicia, su antigua desarrolladora (Westwood Studios, el cual a fines de 1999 fue absorvida por EA) habÃ­a generado 2 lineas temporales: la 1era basada en la guerra fria entre las potencias occidentales Vs. La UniÃ³n Sovietica (URSS) y la 2da en la que se basaba originariamente C&C:  El universo de Tiberium.

 Para hacerlo breve: en la decada del 90 en Europa del Este cae un meteorito con un mineral verde llamado Tiberium el cual empieza a esparcirse por todo el continente, y que consume los recursos y minerales de la Tierra, no obstante, su letalidad con todo ente biÃ³tico con que entre en contacto tambien es consumido por el cristal, lo que genera una amenaza grave para la sociedad mundial. Es entonces cuando surge del anonimato una sociedad secreta que adoraba al cristal, conocido como la Hermandad de Nod, liderada por un sujeto megalÃ³mano conocido como Kane (el cual se lo considera el mesias, habÃ­a predicado la nueva era de tiberium para la humanidad, etc. No muere realmente en casi ningun juego). la ONU, para contrarestar a esta organizaciÃ³n de que asimilen para ellos solos el cristal, genera una divisiÃ³n militar internacional contra el terrorismo conocido como la GDI o Global Defense Initiative. Posterior a esto, entre estas facciÃ³nes se generan 3 guerras mundiales (que vendrÃ­an a hacer cada C&C de Tiberium) en el que la cantidad de muertos se cuentan por millones, mientras el tiberium casi consume todo el planeta, destruyendo ecosistemas y extinguiendo al ser humano a la par de los conflictos bÃ©licos.

Y es aquÃ­ en el que entra la descripcion de este juego. en el 2062, casi 15 aÃ±os despues de Tiberium Wars. El mundo esta casi totalmente devastado por tiberium, y la extinciÃ³n de la especie humana es casi inminente... pero un dÃ­a Kane, se levanta de su siesta, escuchando Joan Manuel Serrat al canto de "Hoy puede ser un gran dÃ­a", va  a hacer una visita a los directivos de la GDI y les plantea un plan para salvar al mundo del cristal verde y que sean todos hippies, y asÃ­ salvar la humanidad....

... tiene sentido? por supuesto que no. Pero bueno, sacando el sarcasmo, esto es lo que pasÃ³ realmente en este juego. Aparentemente un lider como Kane, el cual declarÃ³ la guerra a GDI, y fue participe de genocidios masivos, como hacer desaparecer casi toda europa con una bomba de tiberio liquido, de repente quiere aliarse contra sus peores enemigos con los cuales hizo guerras durante 80 aÃ±os, para reparar el mundo (Â¿?) cuando Ã©l mismo querÃ­a que el planeta sea consumida por Ã©l....
Si no tiene sentido, estÃ¡ el guionista del juego, un tal Sam Bass, que se merece una patada en el trasero por esto. Supuestamente ESTE iba a ser el ULTIMO juego del universo de Tiberium... y asÃ­ lo dejÃ³.

 Que desastre... y otros se quejaban del final de Mass Effect 3...

Ok, con respecto al juego, que tenga el titulo de C&C no implica que se sienta como uno. Este juego es el intento de EA de hacer novedad en la franquicia, generando un MOBA, pero destruye lo que hizo clÃ¡sico al C&C, poniendo limite de poblaciÃ³n, y sacando la construcciÃ³n de bases, y NO HAY TIBERIUM (hay algun cristalito por allÃ­ en los mapas para mejorar poderes, pero no hay lo mas importante del juego!) por ende, no hay recolecciÃ³n de recursos. La idea es hacer un edificio mÃ³vil (Crawler) que permite la construcciÃ³n de unidades de forma inmediata. Las conquistas de los mapas, se tratan de capturar diversos puntos estrategicos hasta que se alcance el limite de puntos, en multiplayer. Aunque llevado a la prÃ¡ctica, el juego es divertido y los mapas estan bien realizados a la par de que los combates no se detienen por nada, aquÃ­ no hay casi referencia a nada de command & conquer que lo hiciera famoso. AdemÃ¡s para aquellos que se hayan comprado el juego, 1ero tienen que jugar la campaÃ±a para luego entrar al multiplayer, porque tiene un sistema de progresiÃ³n de arsenal que se comparte tanto en single como en multi, por ende muchos se aprobechaban de esto y destrozaban a noobs por este tema. A pesar de esto, reconozco que el gameplay es bastante entretenido y divertido, pero se siente muy parecido a un Dawn of War 2, versiÃ³n 2.1 en lugar de que se sienta como un C&C

Para aquel que sea casual, este juego le va a resultar interesante, porque su gameplay es frenÃ©tico y las unidades son bien variadas, pero para el fan hardcore, sabiendo que este serÃ­a el final de 15 aÃ±os de C&C, esto es un disparo a quemarropa al corazÃ³n (EA no piensa volver a este universo, solo utiliza un juego de Facebook horrendo en su lugar), asÃ­ de simple ... al menos que seas capaz de dejar eso de lado y disfrutar el juego simplemente por lo que es y pensar de que  la historia de Kane pudo haber concluido mejor de lo que tristemente fue.
Highly recommended for people who love to torture themselves.

I am 28. I experienced most Westwood titles (c&c 1 / ra 1 ...) and this is by far, the worst in the serie but not only that, it manages to be THE biggest disappointment in the RTS history:
Gradually when went like => C&C 3/ Kanes Wrath (great) => Red Alert 3 (average) => RA3: Uprising (horrible) => C&C 4 (TERRIBLE).
In short: No more base building, Joe Kucan (Kane) doesn't act that well anymore and is an hero (... after being the anti-hero for 15 years...), no defensive strategies (you need to capture points and thus need to go all-on offensive else you lose)...
So many failures in such a great franchise.
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

column8:
Its a fine game. Its not as fun as the old command and conquers but it gets more right then wrong...kind of. it has good graphics,fun multiplayer, decent combat but suffers from some problems like how every unit is a tank, the awful rock paper system, the story is....just the worse and there are just most units that are there just to fill a requirement rather than bring fun new tatics. The game also has the best units in the game locked behind a level wall buuuttt the leveling was made me play for as long as i did and the voice acting is nice tooo. 

Oh the game also has drm which means it can't be a classic like its predecessor's.
Its ok but very underrated.

5/10 average

column8:
EA continue to kill the most famous RTS franchise ever made.  Main annoyance with this game is the camera is zoomed in too close on units - so even at high resolution you have a very limited view of the action.  The game's innovations (selecting one of three tech types before starting the match; mobile base building; RPG experience system) are cumbersome and bring very little to the table.

Waste of money - consider RUSE / Sins of a Solar Empire:  Rebellion instead.

column8:
This is a vast departure from Command and Conquer. There is no base building, uninspired and somewhat lackluster units, and a weird leveling system (you unlock units as you gain levels so someone with level 10 units could join your campaign and breeze you through it hilariously). The multiplayer is not much better. 

The story is forgettable and the acting is mediocre. This game can be avoided altogether.

If you are contemplating buying this because of your history with C&C. Don't waste your time. A monkey could shit better game design. Do yourself a favor and keep your eyes off this one. I bought it on a whim thinking C&C? All the rest were good, why not this one? Immediately put-off by the no base/resource management system. Pick your class? When....when do you choose your class at all throughout this or Red Alert's game series'. What made them think this was a great idea? Innovation? CREATE A DIFFERENT SERIES! Everyone was expecting C&C, instead what we got was the pointy end of the sword that was shoved through the Tiberian series' back. Covered in straight up shit. 

(1)"This whole [i]franchise[/i] is in danger of being covered in a huge cloud of.....sshhhhhit!" 
(2)"Huge cloud of shit?! Wooowww! I think I smell it, come on! Let's go! Come on [i]Red Alert,Tiberian Sun[/i]!!............Hey everybody there's a shit cloud comin'! Run for your lives!"

*Original quotes taken from the movie "Kingpin", [i]1996[/i]. Actors (1) Woody Harrelson and (2) Randy Quaid.

column8:
In an effort to reinvent itself, Tiberian Twilight discards everything enjoyable about the Command and Conquer series and is left with gameplay mechanics that feel both broken and incomplete.

It's no suprise the franchise has been diminished down to a pathetic web browser knockoff.  

The old glory of C&C is gone.  This is a horrible game.

column8:
I would recommend this game for a few reasons only. First off the gameplay is NOTHING like any other C&C game, there is no base building, no resource collection, and no big strategy.  This game does have a good story line to it, Iâ€™ll give them that, and that's why I recommend this game.  Most people love games not for the gameplay or graphics, but for the story line, and this game has a good story line.  This game may be nothing like any other C&C game, and thatâ€™s another reason why I would recommend it, it's new, not just a knockoff of the other games, it's different, and some may hate that, I don't like it but I respect that they tried something new.

Now if youâ€™re new to Command and Conquer let me say I would not recommend this game to you, if you want to get into this franchise then try out C&C Generals, or if you looking for something on Steam, then try Command and Conquer 3 Tiberium Wars.

column8:
This is the ruination of a legacy the likes of which is only matched by the Highlander: the Source, the prequel Star Wars films and Spiderman: One More Day. They destroyed everything that made the games great, turned it into some kind of DotA rip-off, which is ironic in itself and produced a story twist that makes literally NO FUCKING SENSE.

I keep coming back to this as an example of how completely a franchise can be ruined. Don't buy this game, don't even download it illegally. If you have to know what happens, look it up on the wiki and make sure you're not drinking anything.

column8:
I can't pass the login persona screen.
I've create new one, but I can't play. Then when I try to login, keep saying general system error.

Forget everything you learn from cnc 1 - 3 gameplay. This 4th series is whole different gameplay then the previous ones. If you do that, you can still find this game errr.... entertaining  in certain aspects.
Oh and they should decrease the size of the unit displayed in screen. I'm looking at giant tanks, huge interceptors etc... hmmph!

You guys should buy this only when on discounted price, or don't bother purchase it.

column8: It plays a little different than some of the other games in this series, but for me it was still an enjoyable experience.  I should mention I only played the single player portion. I don't like multiplayer because there are too many folks that try to ruin the experience for others as a joke to themselves, so as a general rule I stay away from multiplayer games.  I still had lots of fun with the single player and would recommend to anyone that likes RTS games.  You don't have to play the other games in the series, but you will learn more about the characters if you dd.

column8:
Took me almost half an hour to start this up because the required registration page wouldnÂ´t allow me to create an account. (Support also requires you to be logged in already, I bet the guys at EA find that hilareous)

The point where I could not go on because it was so ultimately boring was about an hour into the game.
Until then I really suffered through the bad interface and the annoyingly low zoom out possibility.

There are other RTS franchises out there already that are a lot closer to what a good C&C used to be. 
Have a look for them instead, your money is not only invested much better, they also actually deserve the support. 

I had this in my library for quite some time since it was part of a bundle. 
This was a good reminder for me why I stay clear from EA titles as much as I can.

column8: started playing command and conquer since it came out in '95. this one is HORRIBLE. i was so jazzed up to see what would come next in the story after tiberium wars and kane's wrath and i was left with the utmost feeling of dissatisfaction. videos are cheezy and look poorly filmed. previous cnc games' vids felt almost like a movie. no base building? no harvesting? ea took a giant shit on this franchise and totally used the name of command and conquer to sell this turd under false pretenses. this is the worst thing to come out of ea; even worse than origin (which is saying something). i don't normally write reviews for games but this one was so crappy that it compelled me to tell people to stay away. STAY AWAY. erase this game from the saga just like indiana jones 4. 0/10.

column8:
This game is filled with endless action....but not the good kind, more like the "WTF, NO F***ING WAY!" kind that you may find whilst being no scoped in COD. A good addition for anyone trying to complete all the C&C but nothing more. After many hours of play i have decided that not only was this game rushed and poorly constructed but that C&C3 is 10 times better in almost every front.

My advice: Just buy C&C3, it's cheaper and better!

column8:
Sooooo............. C&C 4: Tiberian Twilight..........
I've have been a C&C fan since I was 4, aka from 1998. The first game was perhaps the first game I have ever got and was the series that got me into both gaming and real time strategy games. So as you can see, when I heard abotu C&C 4, I was prepared to enbark on a good bye party for my beloved franchise. However, I had to scrap it when a leaked beta information on the gameplay changes the game was gonna make. Therefore I avoided the game like the plague. Once the game was finally released, did I feel guilty of having to abandon the party?
Apparently not cause not only did the reviews show little discouragement but 98% of all the C&C fans like me cryout in anger for the series. Obviously this game recommendation from me was Hell no (and I'll repeat it again at the end for those who are too lazy to read this and skips to the end. 
So why is the game bad? Well the first problem is the gameplay. The gameplay in terms of C&C gameplay felt like it was design by satan. Rather than traditional gameplay where you would collect resources and build both a base and an army to conquer your enemies, the game went Moba like based game with a unusual population limit (which drew me away from the game) and a requirement of playing from other people. Another thing that the game is known to have been hated on is the story. Now I haven't played the campaign but from what I heard, it's a cluster f*(k. 
So is there one thing I like about the game? well......... I do actually enjoy the music which is actually pretty good.
In conclusion, if it wasn't for C&C being in the game, it could have been ok, but the C&C is a perminate damage to the game for I have to say I do not recommend the game

For people who want to skip to the conclusion on whether to own the game or not, the answer is HELL NO.
